Reviews.Title: “Hilton Miami Airport: Decent but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: thevacationlovers Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hilton Miami Airport and found the hotel just average. We appreciated their free boarding pass printing ability. The hotel is relatively far from the airport and the airport shuttle was disorganized.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy stay with a lovely view”
Reviews.Author: Opal28
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the hotel in March and had a wonderful stay. It was definitely what I expected of the Hilton minus the views. I stayed on the 10th floor and the view of the Lagoon was awesome. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. My room was clean, the food was great and the staff very helpful The only downside is the the lack of free WIFI. I did have a good stay though.

Reviews.Title: “A couple nights in Miami”
Reviews.Author: YUKON_12
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for early travelling as we had a really early flight; however this hotel is far away from almost everything. The windows were whistling when we got to our room and I told them it was fixed when we returned to our room. They have a great shuttle service to the Dolphin Mall and airport which was great! The shuttle driver to the airport was a bit grumpy but it was 5 AM!!! .. I would stay there again if we had an early flight out of Miami :) A couple small issues with housekeeping forgetting to replace coffee in the room but not a big deal, overall good service from the front office staff. Beds were comfy but I didn't like the decor at all... not feelin the whole art deco '70's vibe...but that's just me.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: R K
Reviews.Content: My stay 3.9-13 2012 was not so good. I was in room 1204. There was construction on this floor. The construction crews were using percussion drills that were so loud, I could not conduct business or take a nap during the day. Called the front desk. After about 100 rings and 2 minutes later, they finally answered (what if I were calling to report a fire?). All rooms were booked, and they could not help me. Noise finally stopped at 4:30 pm. On 3.16 started to notice bites on forearm and legs. Went to dermatologist. Was told it was bedbug bites. Now I have to disinfect my whole house. Thanks alot Hilton! NEVER will stay there again. :( Went online and found out this hotel is on a list for bedbug infestation. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!! Gave us want we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Eric3600
Reviews.Content: Asked for a view of the city and airport near the top floor. They gave us exactly what we asked for including a view of the lagoon. The room was newly renovated with updated features making the room beautiful. Allthough it was only for one night I would have loved to stay longer. Staff was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: llm82
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I only stayed one night...it was enough. They are renovating the rooms so make sure you have one that is already done. I was in a renovated room but I noticed a lot of things that were already broken or just done poorly. The food was ok but not worth the prices they charge. The worst thing was by far the service. The people at the front desk and guest services were either uninformed or rude. And for all those that are lactose intolerant, you're out of luck when it comes to dairy free creamer.

Reviews.Title: “A good functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mvgame
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 days for a business trip, and it was a nice hotel, quite convenient as our offices are close to the Airport. The rooms were confortable, and clean, and the service nice and spoke both english and spanish. The only fault i might find with it was the breakfast, that you had to chose between full or continental, and have the card so you could be "checked". But it was compensated by the daily invitation we were given for an aperitive and soft drink in the afternoons in the hotel (that could count as a light dinner really). They also have a shuttle service to take you from and to the airport, and also could take you to offices nearby.

Reviews.Title: “My second experience at this hotel. And I like it again!”
Reviews.Author: drumasca
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel because I think the location is great. Is near the airport and near malls. ItÂ´s close to a nice and quiet lagoon. There is a pool outside. You can hear airplanes once in a wile, but itÂ´s not noisy. At the lobby, the hotel has a bar, restaurant and cafe. If you like, there is a starbucks and mc donaldÂ´s near, in a walk distance. The rooms are comfortable. I applied for hilton honors and got a big discount to stay in a larger room. The parking is payed, but itÂ´s not so expensive. They have free shuttle to/from the airport and you can find a payed shuttle to mall (cheap). People at front desk are really nice and helpful. ItÂ´s far from Miami beach and the taxi is expensive. So I rented a car, solved this problem. I should stay at this hotel again if I go back to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “OK for short stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: BusinessPr0fessi0nal
Reviews.Content: Quiet. Good internet in lobby. Pool average. Food OK. Beds comfy. Rooms redecorated. Hmmm what else to say. Not much- far from anything you might want to do on vacation in Miami area. Free shuttle to/from airport a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Now my choice for overnighting @ Miami airport”
Reviews.Author: jcm9000
Reviews.Content: This review is more about the room, im not too demanding when it comes to service, and is from November/December 2011. I have stayed at this hotel twice now, with another reservation booked and based on my stays, further reservations guarateed to be made by me when needing a lay over at Miami airport. I used to use another big chain hotel nearby, but warily gave this hotel a try after reading the reviews. Its in a small business park and has a rather nice entrance. Room was newly renovated, standard size for such a hotel (chair, bed, desk, tv, bathroom, entrance door), food was good, called from dallas to let them know i would be late due to flight delays and the lady on front desk knew who i was as soon as i mentioned my name which i appreciated due to the hassle of flying (and having an international phone - no messing about). Slight error on my amex, email to the hotel, i think it was the general manager that emailed me back, and it was sorted immediately. No worries. On the back of this pleasant stay, booked to stay again a few weeks later and used some HHonours points to get an alcove room. What a room this turned out to be for what is essentially an airport/conference hotel! My room was the top floor of the right hand wing if you look up when facing the entrance. See all that glass curving round the wing? Most (if not all) of it is yours. Very quiet, big sofa, reclining leather seat and footstool, 2 large flatscreen tvs (one in the bedroom area, one in seating area), work space and lots of floor space in the sitting area due to the curved design of the room. All for a tiny premium over a standard room. Im sure there are different design of alcove rooms going by the pic on the website, and i will try these 'square' alcove rooms on another stay i'm sure, but request one of these corner ones if you can. View is great, how can it not be with that much glass. Chap at check-in was very pleasant. I must mention the food in the restaurant was a real surprise as well (service was a bit random though, one good and polite, one clearly had no idea about the basics for working in a restaurant), and the bottle of Zin i had was full of character. Down side? As everyone mentions the shuttle can seem to take a very long time. It wasnt a problem from the hotel - always left as advertised (every 20 mins i think, maybe 30), but seems like it just doesn't leave the hotel if no one is around at the hotel - it can't skip terminals as they are all on the same road. I waited an hour at terminal D this time even after calling the hotel a couple of times so they know you are waiting. I could just grab a cab, but you always think...its just coming, right? I know this is a recurring problem from talking to colleagues, and this really needs sorted. You do stand there watching other hotel shuttles (the exact same vehicles) passing by a few times which has got to lose this hotel business. Oh, and the shuttle is a tad old, but its a short trip after all. I booked an alcove room again for a future stay later in the year (cash). I was offered to upgrade for a small amount of points to upgrade to a King Suite, and i'm expecting good things. If you are still with me after all that, and if you are thinking of staying in this hotel, especially if you are flying through, give it a try and book an alcove room, the small extra cost is absolutely worth it, and honestly, I have yet to find a better room anywhere that you might use for airport layovers. Beware the renovations do appear to be ongoing from recent reviews here, but surely they will be finished before long since both times i have been there at the end of 2011 i have received a renovated room on a renovated floor.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Grounds but?”
Reviews.Author: OMGJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with friends before embarking on a cruise. After long flights (almost 24 hours) we arrived at Miami airport and waited for their courtesy coach; and waited, and waited - over an hour! Check in was efficient however we had not been told that there was a major refurbishment scheme underway on our floor - so dust and construction debris everywhere!The bathroom is small but well appointed and the bed is comfortable. Our room had not yet been updated and was in need of freshening up - especially the carpet. Breakfast was expensive but there is a wide choice, choice of buffet or a la carte. The major treat with this hotel is the outdoor pool area. We were able to take in the sun and relax by the pool in hot, hot sunshine as we watched the planes land and take off every minute. There are beautiful walks by the lake on a decked area. Hotel staff tend to be impersonal - due no doubt to a large turnover of guests but you do expect at this price to have more convivial service. There is a limited lunch menu, we chose burgers and were not disappointed. However, their wines are very expensive. This is an airport hotel but the pool area makes it suitable for a short vacation - if like me you enjoy watching planes. We did not use the fitness suite but it did appear to be well equipped and busy. This is a good hotel, and will probably be better after the refurbishment programme, but expect airport prices!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty towels”
Reviews.Author: rpj2k
Reviews.Content: I am a bit late but I have decided to contribute my experience. Everything about the hotel was fine. I was not expecting much since it was an airport hotel. My one big complaint was the service I received when I called for more towels. They took forever to deliver them. To add insult to injury, the edges were stained with blood. I called for new ones and only received one.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim G
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times when passing through Miami International and have always been pleased. Rooms are very nice, the pool area is very good, and the workout room is fine (although a little small in relationship to the hotel's size). The restaurant is more than adequate and the bar's menu is good too. There is nothing nearby, so don't plan on going anywhere unless you want to drive. The shuttle from the airport is sometimes problematic because if it fills up they don't run extra shuttles. If this happens either get a cab ($20) or start walking to the left on the sidewalk. The shuttle goes from left to right. Airlines on the right end of the terminal (United, US Air) sometimes have this problem. Save money tip for a long weekend. Take the shuttle to the hotel, rent a car there (Hertz has a desk at the hotel, as well as another car company I don't remember), and drive whereever you're going. Drive back Sunday, drop the car off, and stay at the hotel Sunday night. The "off airport" rate from Hertz will save you $20+ per day on a car and a Monday AM flight is normally more than $100 less per person compared to Sunday, which covers the night at the airport. Last time we did this, the Monday AM flight to DC was $250 per person less.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled and dimed, and service needs work”
Reviews.Author: Thom_Hessel
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed for a night at the Hilton Miami Airport. The property is pretty, including a jogging route, and a nice walk around the property and out into the lagoon to see if you could spot a manatee (alas, we did not). The pool could have been cleaner - the deep end had not inconsequential grime and algae issues. Our bathroom was especially nice, looked like it was renovated relatively recently, and had good bath products. No free wifi in the room was a minus (see below). Nice view from the window of the lagoon surrounding us, and of downtown Miami, but the exterior window was dirty enough to harm the view. Bed was too soft for our liking, but some might enjoy a soft bed. Not exclusive to this hotel, and a common policy among its peers, amenities like parking and wifi were not free. They were free to HHonors members, but apparently my HHonors membership was dumped w/o telling me six months ago due to inactivity (despite having spent some of our Hawaii vacation for a few days at their not-cheap Hilton Waikoloa). As a teacher, I'm a leisure traveler - am I supposed to stay in a Hilton every six months? To be fair, wifi was free in the lobby. But at this price point, why am I being nickeled and dimed? I could stay at the Holiday Inn for about the same rate, but get free wifi and parking (and I'm now asking myself why I didn't ...) Finally, bad service did not help matters. My wife wanted to check in and print our boarding passes at the business center. For a hotel who sells itself on airport-related service, printing boarding passes should be near the top of the list. She had the hardest time with the computers and their Internet connection, and the harried desk staff were less than helpful, claiming that the Internet service was provided by a third party. Between that and the the wifi, I felt like I was back in 1999 worrying about Y2K. Hilton, get it together.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anon19
Reviews.Content: The only issue about this hotel for me was getting the free transfer from the airport to the hotel.. Every 20 minutes the shuttles are meant to arrive at MIA to pick you up but it was definitely more like 40 mins for myself and a friend. However on arrival check in was fast, friendly and with free vouchers for snacks, soft drinks and breakfast. We stayed in an executive room with a great view, very spacious and amazingly comfy beds after a 9 hour flight. The food and drinks in the bar were fine, we even sat by the pool as it was warm. I used the gym in the morning which was clean and had lots of equipment for an airport hotel. Continental Breakfast was great again with a large variety of breakfast items. All in all a great Hilton Hotel. The shuttle back was far less painful to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport, nice views”
Reviews.Author: London_Ontario_Kevin
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton as a spot to stay before leaving on a Caribbean cruise. They offered a "cruise package" that included the room, breakfast for two, and shuttle service to the port for the cruise. There is complimentary shuttle sservice from the airport. This hotel is a quick 5 minute ride from the airport. The hotel is well appointed, with the usual restaurant/bar, as well as an outdoor pool with hot tub, and a bar. The grounds around the hotel are very nice, and you can go for a scenic walk down the lagoon. We were upgraded to their business class floor at no additional cost. The rooms were typical, and included a queen size bed, and a balcony that gave a great view of the airport (if you like watching planes come and go), as well as the downtown and the pool area. We were able to obtain free wifi upon check-in, but when we tried to log on the next day, it prompted us to pay at an additional $12.00. Our stay was on a Saturday to Sunday morning, and the business floor was under construction, and was a bit noisy until about 5:00 p.m. It looks like the renovations will be very nice when they are completed. Breakfast in the morning was very good, and we could either order from the menu, or from the buffet. It was a bit crowded, and we had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. We were told the shuttle to the ship would leave at noon hour, but to be down 15 minutes early to board the bus. It was a good thing we were early, as the shuttle actually left at 11:15 (and it was a white shuttle vs. a black one the check-in clerk told us about). Tere doesn't appear to be a lot in the way of restaurants outside the hotel. We took a five minute walk towards the airport where we dined at the 94th Aero Squadron.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above your typical airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MassCouple2
Reviews.Content: We recently took a short vacation to Miami, and instead of contending with the cost and hassle of downtown hotels, decided to stay at the Airport Hilton. Not typically the thing to do on vacation, but the Hilton is set at the end of a peninsula in the middle of a small lake on the other side of the highway from the airport ... actually, a surprisingly nice setting! Also, the highway goes directly to downtown Miami and further over to Miami Beach, as well as connecting to the other major roads (like the turnpike down to the keys and everglades) so it's quite convenient. The hotel itself is quite large (14 floors, I think) and has been around a while (my guess is it was built sometime in the 1960s), but it's been mostly renovated (the front desk clerk said they were currently renovating the top couple of floors) ... however, the elevators really need to be replaced (more on that later). In the back, there's a nice pool and hot tub, with an outside bar and walkway to a gazebo at the tip of the peninsula ... quite relaxing, if you ignore the occasional passing jet airliner. As a Hilton diamond member, since the club floors were closed for renovations, we were put in a very nice suite on the 11th floor with a balcony, separate living room, updated bathroom, and king bed. Only problem was the room was right next to the elevators ... and they were so loud, that you could hear them anytime they were used, on any floor! I'm sure if they were replaced, they would be quieter ... but at their advanced age, with all the use they get, they were very noisy! We had to keep the a/c fan on all night to try to mask the noise. Also, as a diamond member, we got coupons for a full breakfast each morning and appetizers in the bar each evening ... we couldn't take advantage every day we were there, but these were great "perks" and both were quite good. Next time we'll probably stay at one of the Art Deco hotels in South Beach, but the Hilton is a good option, especially if you have a late flight in, or an early flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Great of the airport”
Reviews.Author: danwallace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for Miami airport. The hotel and its decor is a little dated but has perfect amenities including a gym, business centre, wifi and well as excellent dining facilities. The staff are friendly and helpful and the airport shuttle is a great help to have. Rooms could do with better tea / coffee facilities.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: amyredhots
Reviews.Content: Clean, Comfortable rooms/Bed, Modern decor. It was raining so we enjoyed hanging out in the alcove of the room. Not much for food options (very Expensive at hotel) We took a cab to Olive Garden for Lunch, and Had Pizza Hut delivered for dinner>>> :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: bemoBelfast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Miami Airport before a Celebrity X Cruise this week and were more than happy with our experience. On arrival at the airport, the Hotel's free bus was easy to locate and got us to the hotel in less than ten minutes. You have to wait for the bus on the second level and wave it down as it slowly cruises past. The bus is silver and blue and easy to spot. The room at the hotel is very good. Clean, tidy with a very comfortable Hilton bed and excellent bathroom facilities. The reception staff and Concierge were helpful. The $20 breakfast whilst expensive represents excellent value and well worth the investment. The hotel is undergoing some renovation work, though this is being dealt with discretely and did not disturb our two night stay in any way. The hotel has a nice pool area with a good towel service. Very good for relaxing and getting over jet lag. A taxi into the city is expensive, as is everything about Miami. So be warned. If you are looking for a good standard Hotel close to the airport as a stopover you will not be disappointed with the Hilton Miami Airport Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled room.”
Reviews.Author: AliChicag0
Reviews.Content: I was here for four days in January 2012 for a company meeting. The first thing I noticed was that the hotel had been remodeled. My room was really nice, and like most Hilton Hotels I have stayed at, the bed was very comfortable. The pool area is very nice. I used the hotel shuttle from the airport, and back to the airport. It runs every 20 minutes during they day. The food was average, typical of a hotel. It's not bad, but not great, and room service is very expensive. There isn't much within walking distance of this hotel. If you want to walk a mile or so, there are restaurants, grocery stores, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Not Value for money”
Reviews.Author: coachmanLuton
Reviews.Content: I can agree with the others. The extras soon add up. I don't even have a fridge in the room. There are very few electric sockets. I wanted to upgrade to exec but they didn't have any. The reception area is very nice but the rooms to me are standard. Not sure what the name Hilton represents

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jad74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with a friend for one night, arriving late afternoon after a long transatlantic flight. This hotel provided everything we needed in an airport hotel - close enough to the airport with free transfers. Front desk staff were very helpful, food at the bar was really good and well priced and our room was large with very comfortable beds. Breakfast selection was very good - front desk gave us vouchers for free continental breakfast, which was much appreciated! Interior of the hotel is great - clean and relaxing, and unlike a lot of Hilton brand hotels, actually has some character! The only minor problem we had was with the free transfer from the airport - it's advertised as running every 20 minutes, but I believe we ended up waiting around 40 minutes for the shuttle to arrive - not sure if this is normal or was just a one-off. Was also very crowded, and there was no space for passengers at later pick-ups, so they had to wait for the next shuttle. Transfer from hotel to airport the next day was quick and efficient though. Would definitely stay here again if transiting through Miami International.

Reviews.Title: “smart, simple, pleasantly surprised with a hilton with a touch of character”
Reviews.Author: Ummar Y
Reviews.Content: not really a user of the hilton group anymore .... quite bored with their soulless places, but this one was nice - in the rooms at least. friendly front of office manager, allowed a discount to match the price i had seen on the internet even though i hadn't booked in advance. the room was a bit dated but only if you looked carefully around the edges. the subtle retro art deco fit-out was quite nice and appealed to my sense of place. particularly in the bathroom, the design fitted nicely together ... all the right colours finishes and textures for an art deco feel. bed was decent, comfy and not too soft ! clean and comfy overall. comfortable and appropriate for a one nite transit stay on the way home. Although the lack of anything other than the usual pork-infested and overpriced room service menu after 11.30pm was a downer and had to walk to the local grocery store to get some snacks. public areas were fine and services that i used in the few hours i was there were all good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel - feels like a resort!”
Reviews.Author: Like2cruz
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel, and have stayed here several times over the years both for business and pleasure. I usually stay here the night before going on a cruise if leaving out of Miami. The hotel has a variety of room types, and I've tried several, from the standard king to the alcove to the 2 level penthouse. All rooms are clean and comfortable, but I prefer a balcony room if available as I love to watch the planes take off! (As if I didn't fly enough for work). The hotel is literally right across the freeway from the airport, but is surprisingly pretty soundproof - I never have trouble sleeping in the comfy bed. You can watch the planes fly right by - great photo shots for the enthusiast. The property itself feels more like a resort than an airport hotel. It has a huge pool with plenty of seating and lounging area, as well as an outdoor pool bar. The hotel sits on a waterway too, and there is a nice walkway out the back to a gazebo. There is also a nicely marking walking trail around the property. As a Diamond member I got an appetizer in the lounge and non-alcoholic drink coupon to use, as well as continental breakfast in the restaraunt, which can be upgraded for an additional charge. The lounge is right off the lobby, and adjacent to the restaraunt. The inhouse restaraunt is good for a light dinner after a long travel day, and the breakfast buffet is good to get you going; especially if you're heading out on a cruise! Really nice place to layover or begin or end your cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The rooms were extremely clean, the beds were very comfortable. Very Close to the airport. If you are on a higher level and have a balcony when you go out you can hear the traffic, and the planes, but when you go back inside you do not hear anything. The food is quite good but just a tad expensive if you are on a tight budget. Same with the drinks. Over all I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: albenga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night before leaving for Mexico and I was very impressed with the property. The rooms have been recently renovated and we ended up with one with a balcony overlooking the lagoon and airport. We mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary at the front desk and they sent up a very nice fruit platter for us. Brittany at the front desk was amazing, very nice and made check in a breeze even bringing our room keys to us at the lounge where we were waiting for our room to be ready. Will be staying here every time we fly out of Miami!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San JosÃ©, San Jose, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Hotel Description is Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: Suite was to have balcony, dining table and chairs, upgraded bathroom amenities including Roman tub and bathrobes, mini-bar. Balcony had absolutely no furniture (no chair, no table, nothing). Bathroom had no tub, there were no bathrobes. There were no drinking glasses in the bathroom, no wash cloths. There was no mini-bar or refrigerator. The suite did not have a dining table. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, but I probably would have had the same bed in a standard room. Having reserved a suite, which was supposed to be the best room available at this hotel, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Food, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: indexbtr
Reviews.Content: I got a 2 room executive suite - Room 904 - right next the to elevator shaft and faced 1/2 of the airport runway. Although this room had been renovated, the old window system still kept little noise out of this room. The elevator shaft was next door and was noisy. The view from this room was spectacular of downtown Miami and the surrounding lake/lagoon. The living room portion was extremely dark and needed another light fixture. The food downstairs and room service was horrible. Service was good, but whomever is in charge of food puts very little effort to making it taste good. I did not have a car and was stuck eating here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service great time”
Reviews.Author: Rudkin37
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank Brian Ander for the great service he is the Asstistant Director of front office. My family and a family friend were put in this fine hotel by Carnival a day before our Cruise. Brian heard that it was our 25th wedding aniversary he was so kind and upgraded us at no extra charge to a suite. Amazing room clean renovated. You will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Concierge49
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Vic the front officer manager for helping make my stay comfortable. Thomas at the coffee bar made my mornings bearable with good coffee and a smile. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpartyIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: Was in Miami for a conference and stayed here three nights.. This hotel was used for the overflow from the main conference hotel which was the Hyatt Regency Downtown. This Hilton is an excellent property. Rooms are recently renovated and they are fabulous. Large and comfortable, great lighting throughout. Very large modern work area with plenty of outlets. Shower is large, with immediate and plentiful hot water. Although the hotel is close to the airport is was pretty quiet. Staff was all very friendly and helpful. Health club looked spacious. Great outdoor spaces. Excellent pool area, with an outdoor bar and food service. I was told by some conference participants that the Hyatt rooms seemed dated so the Hilton was an outstanding option. They provide a free airport shuttle that runs every 15 minutes. A most enjoyable stay. Can't think of anything to complain about. I was asked three times by different staff if I enjoyed my stay which says they ARE interested in doing their very best.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation”
Reviews.Author: Apuleius
Reviews.Content: Happy to return here for one night at airport prior to early morning flight. Now with great renovated rooms - ask for high floor with lagoon view. Comfy beds and coffee machines make stay comfortable. However newly renovated rooms emphasise shabbiness of public areas including lobby and restaurant which look very dated. Restaurant needs updating with food choices too as poor selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great business location...Need renovation”
Reviews.Author: gs07jas
Reviews.Content: Located about 5 minutes from Miami International Airport, this is a very good property because of the location...and its a Hilton. Service, food, amenities are to Hilton standards. They have a shuttle that can take you to/from the airport scheduled about every 20 minutes. The only complaint I have is the appearance of the hotel / lobby decor outdated. It seems like you go back to the 80's. The rooms, however are renovated,,,,which was way overdue!!! For a property that charges about $200.00 / night there are more luxurious / modern properties out there. property is in front of the blue lagoon where you can have access from the pool area self parking is $15.00 / night and valet is $20.00 Recommend self parking as it is very close to property's entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: evie_g23
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 1 night as we needed to stay close to the airport in Miami. The room was massive (we had standard room) and very modern. We could not hear the airplanes even though our room was overlooking the landing strip :) . Breakfast was buffet with fresh food (they had everything!). Next morning we took the free shuttle to the airport (leaves every 15min, it was a nice touch!). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms and an expanded gym are an improvement”
Reviews.Author: jetwrldtrvlr
Reviews.Content: Much overdue renovation of guest rooms is refreshing however if you plan on sleeping past 7am forget it. Renovation work continues and until its completed the work starts early. Another improvement is the new expanded gym with brand new Precor equipment. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff. Great hotel to relax.”
Reviews.Author: LillyVale
Reviews.Content: I was there for New Year's Eve and I loved the hotel and the service. They offered a upgrade to a room that had a very nice view to the city. It was beautiful day and night. Unfortunately, We decided to spend the NYE in the party at the hotel. The party was very family oriented and the music stop playing because they had a technical problem. Next time will stay there but look for another place to party.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on Blue Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: penright8888
Reviews.Content: After our cruise, we stayed one night at this hotel. It is only 5 minutes from the airport, and 15 to 20 munutes from the cruise ship docks in Miami. The taxi ride is $20 to $30 depending on traffic. The hotel is pretty and clean. it is surrounded by Blue Lagoon, and has a walkway out to the water that allows you to spot sea life in the early mornings or late evenings. The rooms and beds are what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. The pool area is very nice. We got a great deal through Expedia and only paid $126.00 with taxes on Jan. 6. We paid over $200 to stay at the Doubletree on Biscayne Bay, and the hotel is not nearly as nice. We ate at the cafe that has a Great salad bar that includes dessert for $18.00 We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday August 2011”
Reviews.Author: DilbertR
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good facilities, and is in a good setting. The attitude of the desk staff spoiled it though - unhelpful, arrogant and rude. The pricing structures meant that what we thought were free meals (as part of a B&B rate) actually cost quite a bit - 40 USD for breakfast, for example. Pity - a good hotel coudl easily be much better. We will be trying another hotel when we fly through Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Very laid back and over crowded”
Reviews.Author: Antaryami
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the airport and that makes it easy to access. The rooms are decent. However the service is pathetic. Took almost an hour to get food in the room and that too was burnt. The staff is willing to help but guess its just the vacation mood that probably catches on to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravellerVA
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 7th floor was very large and the bathroom had been recently updated and was spa inspired. The complimentary shuttle picked us up after a brief ten minutes and we checked in 15 minutes later because they only had 2 Hotel Staff doing cheeck in at 9pm and there was a line of guests. The Hotel is large and there were Airline crews checking in because it is so close to Miami International. We could hear some renovations going on in nearby rooms but the noise was minor. Updated bedding and modern rolling window coverings and an 18 foot long desk in front of the wall of windows made the room feel new. In the morning we enjoyed walking to the large covered gazebo on the water to watch white cranes. We had a quick $25 taxi to the Port and will stay at this Hilton again when we go on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but greatly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: esd87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week for a trip to a football game in Miami. Overall it is a decent place to stay - staff was mostly nice and we did get a renovated room which was nice. The hotel is located directly across from the airport, which is very convenient. There is a nice garden area and walkway out into the water. I have a personal thing against major hotels (Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott, etc.) that offer the same (or less) amenities as other hotels but try to charge far more. So that being said, here's my perspective: Positives - Renovated rooms are very comfortable and fresh feeling - Airport shuttle is free and convenient - Hotel is close to restaurants and stores Negatives - As a previous reviewer stated, the pool and jacuzzi were not heated as advertised. This was very disappointing as I was looking forward to relaxing during the evenings. Hilton should've put this on their website to tell their guests. - This may be typical, but this Hilton likes to nickel-and-dime you for everything. Parking is $15 a night, internet is $12.95 (I think) per night...and don't get me started on breakfast. A basic continental breakfast that would be free at most Holiday Inn Express, Homewood Suites, or Hampton hotels will cost you $14+ at this Hilton. A cup of juice at the Express Cafe was $4-5!! They will also charge you to use internet and printing in the business center - another free amentity at normal hotels. - Also, as previous reviewer said - you may want to check on construction before coming. Wasn't a major problem but I could hear drilling and hammering during the daytime. In summary, if you prefer Hiltons this is a decent place with comfortable rooms. But if you don't like being nickeled and dimed, and prefer heated pools, I would recommend checking out the Homewood Suites, Hampton Inn, or something comparable in the area. You will most likely save some good $$ and get free breakfast included. Also -- the "Executive Level" rooms in this location are nothing special and the exact same as regular rooms, so don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, well worth for Airport stay over”
Reviews.Author: atmontejo
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night as we were travelling through Miami. We saw the shuttle go past once. My advice is make sure you keep an eye out and flag it down. To be fair when we missed it first time it circled within 10 minutes. The check in was painless. I had booked through American Airlines Online and got a rate of Â£65 for the night. Not sure if this is regular but felt it was a bargain. Our room was one of the refurbished rooms and was immaculate. Bed was comfortable, Shower was good. All in all we were very happy with our 1 night stay. As we have a baby daughter and also as we had an early flight we did not get to check out the hotel bar. I would stay here again if I was to overnight in Miami. It is also one of the closest Hotels to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Brad D
Reviews.Content: I am currently checked in at this hotel and am a HHonors Gold Level Member. Was very excited about staying here based on track record of the Hilton Brand. If you're looking to book a nice hotel in Miami any time soon, PLEASE heed this advice and stay somewhere else. Called 2 days before arrival to ask for quiet executive room since i would be arriving after midnight. I got a regular room (very odd for Gold level members) and woke up to very loud construction noises asked for a different room and was graciously moved but still very loud construction throughout the building. I'm sure this will be a great location in a few months but for the time being, it's way overpriced for a very disappointing experience. What I liked: comfortable beds, good breakfast, close proximity to airport and downtown, friendly staff. What I didn't like: loud construction through hotel that has lasted all day, pool and jacuzzi not heated as advertised. Call and ask if construction is done and if pool and jacuzzi have been fixed before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: narimasu70
Reviews.Content: Very poor start to our vacation. Waited 45 minutes for a shuttle at the airport. By then quite a few people were waiting and the shuttle bus was full when we finally arrived at the hotel.Then it took 1/2 hour to check in because of all the people all arriving at once. Finally got to bed at 2 am. My suggestion is to call as soon as you get your bags and keep calling every ten minutes until your shuttle shows up. Except for this inconvenience, the hotel was up to Hilton standards.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes from the airport and recently renovated.”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Cancelled flight, wanted a hotel close to the airport. The hotel rooms are going through major renovation. The completed rooms are well appointed and very quiet. The pool area is very nice with views of the airport and landing/departing aircraft. Internet was available in the Business Center but at a cost. Lobby bar very nice. Breakfast in the hotel was expensive, either a la carte or if you decided on the breakfast buffet. The area around the hotel seemed very safe and I was able to do a lot of walking on and off the hotel grounds. I would definitely stay there again if I get stuck at MIA again.

Reviews.Title: “Been staying here for years. Nice improvements under way!”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 7th floor. The bathrooms are finally being updated from the 1950s tiles!! It looks like they are completing room/bathroom renovations, 1 floor at a time. I was never bothered by any construction etc. I use this hotel exclusively for my 1 night stays when in and out of MIA. You will hear airplanes since it is across from the airport but it doesn't bother me. Shuttle seemed to be very quick to and from airport. Jose was a very nice driver! The front desk was very attentive and helpful with my requests. I will continue to stay here. Email me if you have any questions or need assistance booking. My email is arik@ariktravel.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good ole Hilton Brand”
Reviews.Author: Geoffoster
Reviews.Content: As with most Hilton hotels, very good overall experience. Close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at Hilton Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: pearsond
Reviews.Content: Great hotel we spent two days here before going to stay at a hotel on South Beach. This hotel was great had a shuttle that took you back and forth to the mall. The staff was very nice. It was nice to relax a couple days; the hotel was peaceful and clean. The only thing I wish they had in the room was a refrigerator and microwave or at least a microwave. They are doing renovation so we had a bad experience the first night about 5:00am my husband went to the bathroom and the floor was covered with water the pipes from the sink was leaking. They did move us to a room that was available at that time which was smaller but it worked until they could get us in another king suite. My husband spoke with Vick the manager after breakfast and he was very apologetic and didn't charge us for the first night. The way he took care of us showed that he was willing to take care of his customer. This would be a hotel I come to again. Thanks for all you help Vick!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: A449
Reviews.Content: They've finally gotten round to giving this hotel the make over it needed. The rooms and some public areas were showing their age, so getting a modernised room on my latest stay was a welcome surprise. Theyâ€™ve done a nice job, completely refurbishing the rooms and bathrooms - it's like staying in a brand new hotel. As in other Hilton room modernisations I've seen, the bathtub has been replaced by a walk-in shower. The main restaurant, the Coral CafÃ©, has been updated too, so it is now a much more welcoming place. There is no Executive Lounge but HHonors Diamond members get breakfast coupons for the Coral CafÃ© (take care though, you will need to pay extra if you want more than a continental breakfast, which feels unnecessarily stingy). We also got coupons for small bottles of water in the room and for a free appetizer each in the bar (which doesn't seem to open during the day!). On previous stays, I have had an upgrade to a suite, but not this time. There is a nice pool area and a free shuttle to and from the Airport, running every 15 min. All in all, I think this property offers reasonable value providing you get a refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvinient location, old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cookeemnstr
Reviews.Content: Bad location unless you plan on staying at the hotel for your entire trip. The hotel was a bit hidden and hard to find ~took the taxi driver a while to figure out where it was. Also, the hotel is out of the way of the major attractions and main part of the city. Although we got a good deal on the hotel, we spent a lot of our money (and time) on taxis. Probably better off spending a little extra for a more centralized hotel. For a Hilton, the rooms were not that nice. Everything looked old. Functional and good if you are just looking for a place to sleep near the airport. Internet and parking is extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, clean and nearby Airport”
Reviews.Author: BPostema
Reviews.Content: Miami Hilton Airport is and efficient hotel nearby the airport. Big building, nice swimmingpool area, clean rooms. Shuttle to airport every 20 minutes. Herz carhire in the building. Nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - December 2011!!!”
Reviews.Author: McTravelalot
Reviews.Content: Last weekend I spent two nights and three days in this hotel. I've stayed there 2 times before. Never had any problems. This time I came back home with bite marks from the bed bugs!!! Just a warning to people planning on staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations”
Reviews.Author: Leila A
Reviews.Content: I would like to give my congratulations to Hilton Miami Airport because they are working to provide a wonderful services their guests. You can feel a really good atmosfhere when you get in, you have a hoster waiting for you in the door saying "Welcome to Hilton", they are remodulating the rooms. What about the view? If you are lucky and get the room in the 12th floor you will be able to see the most beautiful view in Miami.Hilton Miami Airport provide a wonderful package of services for their guests. Thank you,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: Very clean and efficient hotel. Only downside would be that they were doing renovations on my floor and there were lots of DO NOT ENTER signs- well I did not! Lady at breakfast was super nice but german chap at check in was tad stern. They might want to sound proof the rooms as it can feel that you are on the runway!

Reviews.Title: “Score!”
Reviews.Author: BeacheeMe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through AA.com for one night before a cruise and paid $93 plus tax. For that price, I'd have been happy with just "clean." We got more than that. The decor was elegant, the room was surprisingly large, and the pool was very nice. The free shuttle from the airport to the hotel was a plus, though wasn't thrilled with the hotel-to-cruise-port shuttle service: Husband and I paid $30 ($15 each) to take a shuttle to the cruise port before learning our friends paid $23 for a taxi from the airport to the cruise port. The cons of this hotel included some construction on our floor. Some room doors were smudged with plaster/drywall dust. But we never heard any noise. The "bones" of the hotel felt old: The elevator, for example, was kinda slow and rickety. But it was clear this place has enjoyed a very thorough makeover in the not-too-distant past. Everything seemed clean, modern, and tasteful. The hotel lounge downstairs had a nice ambience and was and a perfect place for my husband to enjoy a drink while watching an NFL game. The bar snacks there were okay. We were glad to have the free in-room coffee maker coffee plus a stand downstairs selling coffee and pastries. We didn't try the restaurant. I would have expected to pay about $189 for this hotel, maybe more. So for $93, this was a really great experience that left me with a very positive impression of this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to turn airport delay into a holiday”
Reviews.Author: FrancCabernet
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in this hotel during overnight from Caribbean. Best layover we have ever had. Excellent hotel being updated. Main surprise were the expansive grounds offering room to hike, jog or just be outside. Very well appointed room with excellent and well outfitted business desk in room overlooking view. Prompt shuttle and reasonable restaurant. Good service all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheLeadLap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from November 18th through the 20th. When I checked in they tried to tell me that I had a reservation for the 17th and said they were going to charge me for not showing up. Fortunately, I had my print-out indicating I was not checking in until the 18th, so they cleared it up quickly and without any issue. Room was nice and restaurant was good. Restaurant was a bit pricey, depending on what you are accustomed to paying. I only had breakfast in the restaurant on the day I arrived. I used room service on the 19th and 20th for breakfast and was pleased with the service. The valet guy was a bit elusive, so if valet is important, this is not the hotel for you. Also, the wireless internet was fast. Overall, a nice hotel, but very busy, as most airport hotels are. It appeared to have a very nice pool area. It was certainly a great value and I would have no problem recommending it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Top pet friendly hotel!! Great Room Renovations! Excellent food”
Reviews.Author: Cindywe22
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my dog before a flight. They provided her own pet bed and stainless steel dog dishes. I appreciated they also had a dog walk trail with disposal bags. The hotel is doing major room rennovations! Mine was one of the renovated rooms and the beds were plush and perfect! Be careful if you plan to sleep in the next day they aren't renovating the room next store. If you can get a balcony suite. The balcony was refreshing. Dinner and breakfast were pretty amazing and reasonable compared to some south Florida pricing. They even had cafe express were if you can grab a Starbucks coffee and quick am food item on the run.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice: Showing its Age Overall, but the Rooms are Nicely Renovated”
Reviews.Author: COLadyRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Miami Airport is an older property that has been partially renovated. The exterior is out-dated / showing its age, but the rooms have been very nicely renovated in a sharp, slightly sassy style. The property sits at the end of a cul-de-sac in a hotel/condo/office complex area and boasts great water-front views and views of the Miami skyline. There is a great (if short) .4 mile walking/jogging loop around the tropic. In the middle of a hectic workweek, itâ€™s nice to take a mini â€œtropicalâ€� stroll. The beds are comfortable with a nice selection of pillows and I slept quite well here. The renovated bathrooms are stylish and refreshing and I enjoyed the bathroom amenities and soft towels. There are plenty of downsides, unfortunately. Noise is a big consideration: The hotel is right near the interstate, the take-offs from the airport are quite loud and personal watercraft roar around the waterway in the afternoon. Also, presently during business hours the construction noise can be bothersome in some rooms. The elevators are terribly slow (perhaps 4 cars are simply not enough for a hotel this size) and, while mostly renovated, the lobby area is showing its age and feature a large hole in the ceiling (perhaps from a leak) above the lobby dining area. In sum, this hotel is nothing to get overly excited about, but I will certainly return here for business trips in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: PBKucka
Reviews.Content: The Miami Airport Hilton is a fairly average Hilton property, which is a good thing in the sense that you know what to expect. We needed to catch a very early international flight, so we booked a corner suite in the hotel. This also happened to be St. Patrickâ€™s day, so the room was probably a bit overpriced for what we got, but it was a very nice room. The suite was a 1-bedroom with a separate living room and a balcony off the living room. The bathroom was nicely appointed and included a Jacuzzi tub. It was a great room with a lot of space. I would hesitate to call it â€œluxuryâ€�, but it was certainly a step up from an average room. Since we arrived kind of late and had to leave early, we did not really take advantage of most of the hotel amenities (i.e. breakfast), but it looked like a great hotel. For complaints, I would say there were only two â€“ price: this room cost us $300 for the night. It was a nice room, and I imagine there was a mark-up since it was St. Paddyâ€™s, but probably not worth $300. The other complaint is a common one â€“ no free internet. This issue seems to be inversely relational to the price of a room these days â€“ the more expensive the room, the less likely there seems to be free internet. A $39 room at Motel 6 includes free internet, but a $300 room at a Hilton does not. As far as we can tell, this is pervasive across the Hilton hotel chains that are not business oriented. While this issue is not Hilton specific (most expensive hotel chains do not seem to provide free internet access in the rooms), we still think that paying for internet access in the 21st Century warrants at least a .5 star deduction. It should be noted that the Hilton does provide a Business Center and an Executive Lounge (if you qualify for access) that both have free internet terminals available.

Reviews.Title: “UTMOST HONESTY”
Reviews.Author: ALL4CPA
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hilton on blue lagoon drive, miami florida a couple of weeks ago. As usual the services were impeccable and my stay was memorable. But more importantly is the the high level of honesty of the employees. Upon checking out and on my way to the airport i realized that i had left $300 in an envelop somewhere in my hotel room. I immediately called the front desk and i was connected to the security desk. The security officer i spoke to said he will call me back to see if anyone had found the money.To God be the glory, the security officer called me back within five minutes to say a fellow security officer by the name James had found the money! Kudos to these guys. Emmanuel Danso, CPA

Reviews.Title: “Paris wouldnÂ´t stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Colocha70
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HIlton Miami Airport for two nights in June because they had special offers in the internet. Horrible style, and terribly overprized. They wanted to charge us for leaving the car in the parking lot, and of course, using the laptop in the room and basically whatever thing you could have to pay for, and they ask ridiculous prices. Not even the water bottle in the room was for free, If I remember correctly they wanted 7,- US. The whole place is very ugly and reminded me like one of the Hotels in the Former German Democratic Republik. Just because it is a "Hilton" they thing they are something special. Worst hotel ever. Ridiculous Gym, uncomfortable and ugly restaurant. Breakfast was nice .... but of course overprized. I will certainly not go back. They are refurbishing for the moment though, so there is hope...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: semike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was actually good. The rooms have been remodeled and are now good. On the minus side for the room is the insistence on only offering wall mounted showers. Hotels offering both are better. The Gentleman checking us in was really friendly. Hotel bar was ok but service was slow and drinks really pricey. The biggest minus was the time it took to get there. We had to wait for almost 40 minutes for the shuttle. Once it arrived it was over full leaving some guests to have to stand. The journey to the hotel was thus less than pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: beachfamilyusa
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous when I saw I was on a floor where renovation was still occuring but the noise was almost nonexistent and the room was very nice. Staff in the hotel provides great service. Restaurant menus are limted but adequate. Fitness facility needs a little repair as 2 of the 3 treadmills were out of service when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: USAMiami
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed overnight at the MIA Airport Hilton enroute from London to Buenos Aires, Argentina. I was most impressed with the high level of personal service and with the newly upgraded rooms. There are great hotel amenities set in beautiful surroundings. Additionally, there is a re-newed comittment to "Excellence" led by the Front Office management team. This embodies the Hilton ethos of welcoming each guest as an individual, and seeking to meet the special needs of an honored guest. I had a great stay and I have no hesitation in higly recommending this hotel for business and leisure stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel undergoing a major renovation”
Reviews.Author: howudoinnj
Reviews.Content: We traveld to this hotel the day before setting out on a cruise to the Bahamas. Entering, you're greeted by a very spacious lobby and a very friendly and prompt check in staff. Downstairs also offers a gift shop, dining area, as well as a bar (that also serves quick breakfast items and Starbucks coffee in the morning, although at hotel prices). The rooms are currently undergoing a major renovation, however we were lucky enough to get one of the new rooms, offering a nice flat screen TV, very large and comfortable King size bed, as well as a refurbished shower and bathroom area. The hotel also offers a hot tub and swimming pool, sauna, and physical fitness center, all that appeared in very good shape. Food quality for breakfast and dinner at the restaurant was wonderful, though expensive. As I've said in previous posts, a Hilton is a Hilton, and that lives true to this hotel. But would you want it any other way?

Reviews.Title: “A Fixer Upper being fixed up.”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight here last night on a quick business stop. The hotel is not new....but is undergoing some renovations in the guest rooms. I got to stay in one of the just renewed rooms and I must say they have done a very nice job. Very chic, clean and fresh feeling.....I had an 11th floor room with a few of the airport.....the rooms has very effective roll up/down window sun shades........two layers........and the room is well sound proofed. All new technology. And the rate compares favorably with comparable and even with lesser properties nearby. A very nice work space and good internet speed. The lobby and bar have also been updated in fairly recent times.....and is also comfortable and chic. The only thing I can wonder about is why they didn't put more electrical outlets in the guest rooms. If you plug in your smart phone, a computer and and iPad.......no place for the iron......but not a big deal. Also I was impressed with the staff.....very friendly and eager service from the shuttle drivers to desk clerks to waitresses to bar attendants......a very nice experience. If one is staying overnight at the airport I'd give it a tumble. It's a good buy......and just feels homey.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Dominic1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights as a layover, great value, great service, nice room, good food. Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “hammer drill noise..no respect”
Reviews.Author: carlostpa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in August and now again on October, and I have forgotten how bad it was. I understand the hotel is going a renovation phase but it does not make any sense to star the hammer drills at 8:50 in the morning for 2 hours and the it shuts down. My question is why can they begin their loud sounds phase of the construction around noon?. Some of us get in late at night and want to sleep a little late but CAN NOT. We call the front desk and explain the noise situation and they treat you as if we are a pest . My two cents.....PLEASE PLAN THE DRILLING LATE ON THE DAY AND HAVE YOUR EMPLOYEES TREAT YOUR CUSTOMERS BETTER WHEN IT COMES TO THE NOISE SITUATION. CARLOS R. TAMPA, FL

Reviews.Title: “Will be really nice when reno's are complete”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1971
Reviews.Content: Shuttle bus was easy to get at the airport. Hotel is nice and close. Room was big but double beds are too small for adults. Nice touch having a free shuttle bus to the Dolphin Mall. Super friendly bartenders in the lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Ana - Open House 2011”
Reviews.Author: ana a
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredible!!! The food expectacular!!! And the service is number 1, I really recommend this Hotel..You will enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Property is much nicer than what you see from a distance.”
Reviews.Author: BrianDeKemper
Reviews.Content: From a distance, this property has the "old school" Hilton logo, which makes you think that it may be a dumpy old airport hotel. I was absolutely delighted to find out that this place has been gutted from top to bottom and is recently completely renovated. Everything from the lobby, bar, rooms, bathrooms are all exactly what you'd hope for in a property in this price range. The first room that I was given had some very strange and loud electrical noise coming from the neon on top of the building, but after talking to Christian and Kim at the front desk, they wasted no time in checking out the issue and immediately getting me put into a new room. Kim also got me a drink from the bar for the trouble. Again, if you are just crashing at the airport before or after a flight, this place is definitely one that I'd recommend to any business or leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a stay close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand_nl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the runway of Miami international airport. Isolation is adequate but still there is some sound of arriving and departing planes. It is located in a beautifull artifical lagoon. The hotel has a bar, restaurant and a pool. Breakfast si good though not special. Rooms are just acceptable but notmore than that. I would only recommend this hotel if you have an early departure or late arrival in Miami airport abd want to stay close to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: NRNYC
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel But it's a lil dated it needs some room renovation the nice thing is it provides an airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “GreatÂ¡Â¡Â¡”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo V
Reviews.Content: The updated rooms are amazing. The staff so helpfull & smiley, the shuttle so convinient (starting at 5 am), one corner of the pool was a little bit dirty, but it was great for a sunny Sunday. Great sleep quality; my family and I all ready miss Miami because of all that.The price of the beer in the pool bar not expensive, also the in-room dining. 42" Flat tv with digital sign. The parking lot is huge, and, even when we did'nt use the tenis court, looked great. Everyone at the hotel -maintenment,houskeeper,front desk, Felix the taxi driver- saying things like "hello" "have a good day", "come back soon", "this is an special delivery" -about our drinks and snacks at the pool- (thanks Manny). The guy at the coffe shop,very early in the morning with really good mood selling us yogurt with fruit,in a very kind way. Thanks to everyone at the Hilton Miami Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff , hotel needs revamp”
Reviews.Author: brannagan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre-cruise ,this was our second visit to this hotel the last one being 2005,check in was pretty quick(nice after long flight) however when we got to the room it smelled terrible , I went straight back down to reception they gave me another, same problem , they eventually gave us a room with a balcony still a bit smelly but by that time we accepted it dropped the luggage and headed for the bar, the rooms are in need of upgrading , everything was old and a bit worn out.. On the plus side I must say the staff were incredibly helpful and appoligetic In the morning I had the best eggs benedict I have ever had, and again nice staff, however I don't think we would return unless it had a refurb

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: mstru
Reviews.Content: this property is a little older, so they were undergoing rennovations, as displayed in signs throughthout the halls. we checked in really late, so were pretty tired, and hungry. a lady in the dining area, was nice enough to allow us to grab some fruit without charge. so initial impressions were good. upon arriving to our room. we were a bit disappointed to smell a faint paint odor, but just wanting to sleep, we said nothing, however, realizing shortly after that there was no fridge, neither the ac or fan were working, and the noise of the planes nearby was constant, we asked to switch rooms. the new room didn't smell like paint, and even though there was no fridge we were happy the fan worked.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected that Hilton in US like Holiday Inn in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Vereshchagin
Reviews.Content: Was sure thtat Hilton is 5 star brand that provides excellent hotel and service. Unfortunately not in US, very poor quality of food compare with Europenian Hilton and they sent to garbage my battery that was delivered to them few month ago ( I ask them to keep it). I completely disappointed I wouldn't recommend this hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room rather outdated, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Perlutex
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in would need refurbishment, at least everything was clean and tidy. Breakfast buffet was delicious, big choice of fresh fruits, very kind service.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished Rooms fresh and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MIA Hilton en route to business in Cancun. After arrival from London, I transferred to the hotel using the courtesy van. This could been better. Whilst it was a holiday in the US, the frequency of vans was poor and I had to wait an extended period. Interestingly when I stayed at The Embassy Suites here in July, I had a similar problem - but like then, I observed numerous vans from other hotels. When the van arrived the driver was friendly and helpful, and it took only about 10 minutes to get to the hotel. The hotel was quiet due to the holiday and check in was helpful - the lady on receptionist very helpful. Unfortunately most of her advice was useless as I was leaving very early the next day. I had one of the newly refurbished rooms on a high floor. It was clean and fresh and I liked the appearence. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of space. I had a spectacular view over the pool and Blue Lagoon toward downtown, made more interesting by the aircraft arrivals passing by. The bathroom had also been refurbished - frusrtatingly it had a large walk in shower, which in itself was not a problem, but this was at the expense of a tub. And after a long flight, I like a soak in the tub. The towels appeared new, but there were no washcloths which was again frustrating. I ate in the bar - it was dead with only one other person in there, and service was friendly and efficient. I'd have rated this property with 5 stars if the bathroom had contained a bath, if there had been washcloths, and if the shuttle had come quickly. But I will still give 4 stars as the hotel was nice, the refurbished room works well, and everyone was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Property With Just a Few Minor Negatives”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I noticed that they had a sign up advertising that they are currently renovating rooms. I asked to be in a new room so I could review it for Trip Advisor. I was placed on the 13th floor in 1307. I am not superstitious but I cannot remember the last hotel I stayed with an actual 13th floor! Fun! My room had a small balcony which was nice but did not have chairs. It is as I found out, just a place where others go to smoke as it wafted up and around me into my room from other guests. Airport noise was minimal except when large (767, 777, 747) planes took off on the runway next to the hotel. They have removed the Executive Lounge in lieu of a free appetizer in the bar for Gold and Diamond members. The newly renovated room was nice and up to Hilton standards. They tried to add some boutique flair with the tower light and the bathroom was very nice with a backlit mirror that is very appealing. Normally I prefer a shower head with multiple settings but found their large rain (photo attached) head very nice with good water pressure. The desk lamps were cute but completely non-practical. See the photos - the 'genie bottle' style makes it absolutely impossible to plug in anything with a larger plug such as a cell phone. Business travelers NEED power for laptops, notepads, phones and other accessories. Apparently the designer uses none of these things! The TV was a nice, large unit as I would expect in any newly stocked room today. The pool was very nice and had one of the smoothest floors in a cement pool I have encountered. A nice thing. The hottub while small was just what I needed after a long run on the treadmill. Speaking of the fitness center, they have just 3 treadmills and therefore have been programmed to only allow a 30 minute session. They could probably squeeze in more and take that away. There was one recumbent bike, 2 ellipticals and 2 weight benches with dumbells. Fitballs were also available. A nice touch on the Precor machines is the TV complete with regualr headphones (disposable pads available). I like this as I despise ear buds when I am running and usually forget my cheap headphones at home. I will NOT use my good Bose when running. Lastly, the breakfast. As a perpetual Diamond member, the continental portion of their breakfast buffet is free. It was really good but was dissapointed that they did not open until 6:30. Most hotels open at 6 so you can still catch early flights. My flight was at 8 and I was pushing it by eating at 6:30. They saw me waiting from 6:15 but did not even bother to ask me any questions or acknowledge me standing there even though the buffet was 99% stocked already. Overall, a nice property. It has that larger property/big pool/pool bar throwback resort feel despite being an airport hotel. I will definitely stay here again when faced with an early MIA flight.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton -- Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: newslettereditor
Reviews.Content: Due to a medical emergency, my wife and I were diverted from our Island of St. Lucia destination for medical attention in Miami, so while she was being attended to in the hospital for 4 nights, I was the guest of the Hilton, Miami Airport. They found space for me amidst their renovations and kept renewing my reservation one day at a time until we knew that we were free to return home. I cannot begin to express my gratitude for the wonderful, personalized service and care I was given during the trying experience I went through. The entire staff seemed to know there was something amiss, judging by the number of total strangers who asked about her condition. When she was finally released, we had one night together at the hotel before flying home to Canada, and she was greeted in the lobby like a long lost friend. Minutes after arriving in our room a beautiful fruit tray arrived compliments of the front desk staff. I could go on detailing my experience and extoling the virtues of this hotel, but I just wanted to take the opportunity to publicly thank the staff and give them a big 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Makemineadouble
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise. We got there early since the cruise wants you out early. We used the pool since no rooms were open. A tropical storm came by and got everything soaked we had like our luggage. We went into the lobby wet. It was around 1:00 now and they still had no rooms open so we ate at the verynexpensive restaurant there. After lunch we sat around waiting. I asked them why they didn't have any rooms open in this huge hotel and they said half was being remodeled. We checked in and the room was newly remodeled. We went out to dinner and when we got back, the air wasn't working so they moved us to another room and this room was old and smelly. It was probably open the whole time but those jerk employees didn't want to give it to us and we would of paid extra for early check in. So this place wasn't good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Quick Miami Jaunt”
Reviews.Author: Dawkito20
Reviews.Content: While house hunting in Miami, my husband and I stayed at the Hilton Miami Airport & Towers. For an "airport hotel," it was surprisingly nice and not noisy. In fact, our room overlooked the airport --- we would watch planes take-off and land and couldn't hear a thing! Very nicely sound proofed. The bathroom left much to be desired --- small and outdated, the only nice thing about it was the Peter Thomas Roth amenities (a very unexpected, but welcomed surprise). There are renovations underway at the property, so hopefully this is something that will be tackled down the road! The rest of the room was average. We didn't spend much time though inside ... If you're looking for a family resort with all the fixings (and near a beach), this probably isn't the best fit. This hotel was definitely geared more for business travelers. However, it was nice for what we used it for --- a place to sleep. Note: Self-parking was $15 plus tax. You used your room card to get access to the outdoor parking areas and could come and go as you wished.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing dated rooms, but great service and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTeacher
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night because of the hotel's proximity to Miami Airport and its free shuttle service. The lobby area is very nice and service was excellent. I arrived before I could check in and was invited to have breakfast and was able to leave my bags all day with the concierge service. Another positive is that you can check in online using free computers at the main door to the lobby and print out boarding cards for free. Unfortunately the room was disappointing. While clean, and with a comfortable bed, it was not huge and needs some renovation. The bathroom was also not great - a very poor shower and yellow watermarks on the shower curtain. There was a nice view from the window of the pool and lakes but the window was too dirty to take a picture from and there was a fair bit of aircraft noise. I didn't use the pool although it looked nice from a distance. The hotel did the job but I've stayed in much better (and cheaper) hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JGB007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a refurbishment. We stayed in a newly decorated executive room. Although pleasant, the room was small and had none of the usual perks associated with the executive level. There is no executive lounge and breakfast was not included. We ate at the restaurant and the buffet was extremely poor (but expensive). The staff at reception were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lville3
Reviews.Content: Being a loyal Hilton Hhonors member, I stay at Hilton hotels more often than other brands, and I have stayed at many of them around the world. This Hilton did not wow my family and I with any glitz and glamor, but it was a really good experience where we encountered no problems, enjoyed good, prompt and courteous service from airport pick-up to check-in to check-out, very clean and comfortable rooms, and a better-than-usual continental breakfast as one of my Hhonors perks. The fact that we encountered no problems is especially impressive, and something that cannot be said of the three other hotels (including another Hilton) which we stayed at on this particular trip. Some of the good things that especially stood out: service in the cafe was super-friendly; the continental breakfast in the cafe was more impressive than the free continental breakfasts I usually get in Hiltons (usually in their executive lounges) --in particular, they had lots of good fruit options; and the pool area was really nice, much nicer than we would expect for an airport hotel. Some of the things that probably could have been better: The decor in the rooms is fine, but looks a little drab. This really isn't that important to us when we're staying at airport hotels though. We definitely felt like we got our money's worth, and will choose this hotel again when travelling through Miami.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Hiltons!!! Featured in Up In The Air movie :)”
Reviews.Author: Road W
Reviews.Content: Stayed there every week for 2-3 months during Winter-Spring 2010. Staff was excellent. Hotel is clean and if you get a suite - it is spacious and very comfortable! Some suites have balconies that are pleasant and can be enjoyed if you are into airplanes and jet engines, because you are facing one very busy airport. Sound proofing is not bad, and if you are an early raiser - you will be fine. First flights leave around 6 AM :) The lobby is beautiful. Breakfast selection is one of the better ones and gets close to the European Hilton breakfast. One down side - there isn't much to do around hotel and certainly nothing in a walking distance. South Beach is about 20-30 minutes ride from there. Gym is located outside and you better get there early if you want to find open machine. It is a convenient location for a business traveler. A lot of Cruise travelers go through that hotel, so get ready to share a very slow ride in an elevator filled with oversize luggage and cruise goers at times.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: midori
Reviews.Content: Got a good price directly through their website. Since I was getting in late after traveling all day I wanted a place with 24 hour room service, yet since I was not leaving til late afternoon the following day wanted a place with some grounds to walk around. The free shuttle showed up after a few minutes and it was a quick 5 minutes to the hotel. Check in was quick, as was ordering ordering food from room service. Breakfast was included and it was a huge buffet with many choices. The outdoor areas are nice, especially the area near the pool. Couldn't hear the planes at all inside the hotel and only barely outside, despite the fact that it is right across the street. My only complaint would be the a/c - when I walked into my room it was set at 55. The lobby and the shuttles were also kept extremely cold. I understand people would complain if it was reversed and kept at a much higher temp, but I think 55 in a room is overkill. Overall it was a nice stay and if I had to overnight in Miami again would definitely choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: vinchy
