Reviews.Content: God clean and pleasent hotel near the airport .most staff rather pleasant

Reviews.Title: “A find within limits”
Reviews.Author: Amen9
Reviews.Content: Undergoing remodeling. But, even as it is, it is a good bargain for this area. Old rooms are decent and clean. Really convienent. Good bar and restaurant and a really helpful staff. Not a luxury Miami Hotel, but good value and nothing wrong that will (should) freak you out. Great for a business meeting. Just 5 minutes from airport. Staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad”
Reviews.Author: paris h
Reviews.Content: I find it amazing that some people actually rate this hotel highly (maybe the employees post flattering reviews or travel weary folks from Latin America). The hotel is antiquated. The carpet in the hotel smells like a wet dog. The hotel sparing the lobby smells like an old library. The appliances in my room were old, circa 1980's or 1990's at best (the coffee maker was really pathetic). Almost nothing is complimentary: $15 daily parking fee, $4.95/hr or $12.95/day for internet in room, $5/15 min(or $20/hr) for internet in the business center, various fees for fax/printing in the business center. The hotel is located somewhat far away from local shops making a car a necessity(and don't forget the concomitant $15/day for parking). One can try walking to the shops but the Miami heat will eventually sap your strength and enthusiasm. Don't forget the loud chatting among employees in the hallways during the morning hours. During my stay, the floor above mine was being renovated and I was promptly awaken by the hammering and drilling at 8:30 am(the great thing is an alarm is not needed). The only redeeming qualities of this hotel are the pool and view. Maybe in a year the hotel will be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: GabiLuna
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff Comfortable beds Free shuttle to airport Cons: Smelly carpet Limited menu in restaurant Internet fee

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Mancio74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the airport and so very useful if you travel but far from downtown. Service is standard, nothing special, rooms are big but they seem quite old fashion (like in the '70s). You can enjoy a swimming pool not so crowded but it's definitely better in my opinion to chhose something downtown.

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst hotel I have stayed at in a long time”
Reviews.Author: MNwanderers
Reviews.Content: Luckily the hotel is being remodeled, so it can only get better. To start off, there is a terrible smell in the hallway....like carpet glue meets dirty diapers. The room was not clean. The drains were clogged. The AC did not work well. The staff was not friendly. And the food was terrible. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap night rate but beware with the extras...”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: This hotel features a very low nightly rate, but you should beware of all the extras they will nickle and dime you. The internet is very expensive and it does NOT WORK AT ALL ! The hotel has a very nice pool and SPA. It also has the option to rent kayaks to appreciate the blue lagoon. It is a bit noisy during times since it is located at the end of the MIA airport runway. The noise did not bother us at all, but it may be bothersome for others. Make sure you get the rate that includes breakfast otherwise you'll break the bank. There are a few shops and fast foods around, however, make sure you have your Spanish trained because most of the people around this area speak very little English.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Airport - lots of museum pieces”
Reviews.Author: petewanner
Reviews.Content: Remember Corrosion Corner at the airport with all the old aircaft of airlines long gone - remember the PanAm head office that still stands - remember the Eastern Airlines hangar that is just being torn down - well there is also the Hilton Airport - majestic in its day, but tired and should be put out to pasture. The rooms are tired, clean but worn. The bathroom is very old but clean. The hallways are well-used. Paid for the Executive floor - that is the that was just above me and under renovation. Once all renovated (a couple of years) I will go back - until then, off to one of the other offerings

Reviews.Title: “You can get a decent room at Miami Airport Hilton Towerrs if you're careful”
Reviews.Author: BarryD
Reviews.Content: One other reviewer of this hotel noted some time ago that he didn't like it because the room smelled. When I overnighted the, I made this discovery ( thanks to an informative hotel employee): the hotel is an old one and is undergoing gradual renovations that have started on the higher floors, moving down (more infrastructure like a/c systems than looks). My first room on the 5th floor was stuffy. It w cooler in the hallway. I cranked the thermostat all the way down -- no effect. Then I was changed to a 4th floor room. Same thing with the thermostat (even tho someone else had already tried the same thing) this one did have an odd smell. That's when a helpful desk person put me in a room on one of the higher renovated floors (11) which was fine. If Hilton knows this hotel has a problem, it should act accordingly in terms of wherer they put people, especially if the hotel is not heavily booked. I wasted about 45 minutes on this when I was anxious to get downtown. That being said, the staff goes out of its way to please.

Reviews.Title: “Currently under renovation”
Reviews.Author: beachy101
Reviews.Content: The property was nice, but is currently undergoing a renovation. Unfortunately, we were one of the (un)lucky ones that was awakened by loud construction noises above or beside our room. Also the tub had soap scum that was visable to the eye. We had to call housekeeping upon our arrival into our room which was late in the evening to have them clean the bathroom. It is a neat location on a lake and there is also a nice swimming pool. I'm sure once the construction updates are completed it will be lovely with a much better chance of uninterupped sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport stop over ever!”
Reviews.Author: ozzybelize
Reviews.Content: If you ever have to go through the horror of a lay over at Miami go to the Hilton and be treated like royalty. I wish we had stayed an extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Really unimpressive, actually very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedBusTrav
Reviews.Content: How can this hotel be a 4 Diamond AAA award winner? What does this even mean? Their awards are the first thing you see alongside the check in area. However, the check in and check out was one of the worst I have ever experienced. Sure, they had my reservation and it turned out that we were upgraded to a suite. However, the front desk clerk was jot the least bit welcoming, did not ask how our journey was which in my experience has become fairly standard. We had reserved a day room which basically means we have a room from 10 am until 5 pm, this was a way in which we killed time when we arrived at Miami airport on our American Airlines flight from St. Martin just before noon, with our Virgin flight to London not departing until 8:45 pm that evening. We proceeded to our room after the lackluster greeting to find we were upgraded. However, there was no mention of this by the front deck clerk. Further, as I looked round more carefully, I noticed that the carpeting was filthy particularly underneath the various pieces of furniture in the dining area. There was also a large piece of moulding that had come loose in the door frame leading to the room next door. We were in room 1032. We then spend most of our afternoon at the pool, first having lunch which was just ok but very overpriced. More disturbing was the fact that when I asked at the pool bar whether they made smoothies with fresh fruit, I was told that they had o fresh fruit. Isn't this Miami, and weren't we staying at what is apparently an award winning hotel?! Upon checkout, the front desk clerk was even worse than the one who checked us in, this one had absolutely no personality, did not ask one thing about our stay or whether we needed transportation somewhere. Of course, there is the free shuttle to the airport and I have to say that this is the best thing about this hotel. Right on time, every 20 minutes, and even more importantly, very friendly and helpful drivers who actually said hello and helped us with our bags.

Reviews.Title: “A real drop in service levels”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Miami for 2 days of personal business. We have stayed often at the Airport Hilton and consider it our 'go to' hotel. I don't know if there has been a change in management, but this stay was such a disappointment. For example; - when we went to our first room there was a musky smell, as if the rugs were damp and needed cleaning. I asked for a new room which they quickly did, but it smelled only marginally better. When I raised it with the front desk again as we were heading out they checked with management and I was told "you've already switched rooms once, so that's all we can do". - we always rent a car and valet park. Of the 5 or 6 times I stopped at the valet, both coming and going, there was no valet attendant. I often had to go to the front desk asking if there was someone to take the car. - for 1 whole day there were fans in the hallway of our floor, again suggesting there had been a water problem with the carpets. On the good side, the breakfast is always a great .... something we always count on with Hilton and the location is good. Otherwise, one of the poorest stays we've had with Hilton anywhere in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 stars, perhaps four and a half out of 5”
Reviews.Author: DAN71395
Reviews.Content: What I liked about the hotel: 1. Very nice when you walk in, beautiful lobby, wide open, sunny, lots of plants inside, again very nice big lobby. 2. The rooms are spacious (I did not have a suite). This could be because the hotel is older and today rooms are probably build somewhat smaller. I enjoyed having a more spacious room. 3. I chose a room facing the airport and I enjoyed watching the planes while working at the desk at the window. I thought this was great and I did not find the noise a problem, and am surprised at some of the reviews on this subject. 4. Check in check out very good. 5. The grounds are really pretty, including a boardwalk to a gazebo on the lagoon. There is very nice landscaping outside and many nice plants inside this hotel. It is not a cookie cutter hotel like some of the chains. The property has some unique and desirable features. My criticisms would or could include 1. Charge for internet service @$12.95 and if you don't pay, it blocks your i-phone access to internet; in my case since I am a Hilton member, I did not have to pay. 2. The room was $94 and $15 for parking. (Another $13 in taxes, state, local etc). I didn't like paying $15 for parking. Breakfast would not have been included, but it was for me because I am a Hilton Gold Card member. However, only the continental part of the buffet; I was not allowed to have the hot items with the coupon provided. My total bill for the hotel, parking, and taxes was $122.38 and that was with AAA discount and for one person. Probably one of the better rates, especially since it included internet and continental breakfast. In addition, I will get Hilton Honors points for the stay. In conclusion, I will probably stay here again; I think it was a solid experience, and very comfortable. I enjoy this type of property and find it very desirable. It is relatively convenient to drive to Cocunut Grove and Coral Gables which are two enjoyable parts of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Goetzie
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of our trip at this hotel. We had to catch a 6am flight so this hotel was perfect for a close location. We ate dinner at the hotel since we didn't see too many other places nearby. The pool and pool bar area were nice.....right on the water. There is a walkway out on to a little pennisula that had bunnies and birds to watch. This is a big hotel but it worked out well for us.

Reviews.Title: “average for a holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: alderion
Reviews.Content: Only problem is this isn't a holiday inn... There was a new front desk clerk that checked us in she was very nice. The night shift manager was the exact opposite. I called in with a question about their internet and when I told her what room I was in she did everything but outright call me a liar. I suppose it hadn't went through on their computer or something. Anyway the hotel is older and needs renovations. The restaurant is ok but nothing to write home about. The internet is per device. If you have multiple devices such as a computer and smartphone you will need to buy it for each. The location is great but I don't think I would go back there are lots of other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: loisbeaty
Reviews.Content: Everyone working in hotel was very friendly and helpful. Clean and quiet and close to airport with free shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient. Friendly staff. Quiet. Efficient.”
Reviews.Author: JamesinGeneva
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a quick stopover. Efficient and friendly shuttle. Quiet despite location five minutes from the airport. Good gym and pool. Spacious rooms. Copious breakfast. No complaints whatsoever. Have returned here several times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MTaylor218
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton Hotel Miami due to a cancelled flight back to London in December. I was not expecting a lot from an airport Hilton but I was pleasantly surprised... The room was spacious and the breakfast (room service) was delicious and was brought to my room by a very enjoyable waiter that made my day. If anyone need to stay over at Miami Airport for one night, I think there is no choice but to stay at the Hilton The only downside actually was that I had to wait over 20 min for the hotel bus to come to the Airport bus stop and I was already unhappy with my cancelled flight so it seemed like ages.

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmc038
Reviews.Content: Describe the service you experienced-; Room was very small and dusty Tell us how you liked the room-: Didnot like the room. The room had smelt very bad. Talk about the location & amenities-:Great access to the major highways Say what you liked best & least-: Nothing

Reviews.Title: “Great Miami Airport Area hotel with one exception”
Reviews.Author: ScooterTwo
Reviews.Content: I travel to Miami for two reasons: business, or to overnight on my way to another business location outside of the USA. I am Hilton Honors Gold and have been for many years. This hotel is close to the airport. Staff is excellent. Shuttle service is excellent. Exec floor is being remodeled so it is really not available now. I stayed last night. I had a very pleasant room with couch, table, complimentary internet (I hate the folks that clip you $15 a day for the internet), two bottles of water, a fantastic late night Cuban bean soup...a good night. I was in room 701 which did face the airport so it did have airport noise, but that really does not bother me as I can sleep through most anything. Try for a room not facing the airport if you are a light sleeper, but it is an airport hotel. My biggest gripe is that they NO LONGER HAVE THE BLUE AND GOLD MACAW PARROTS out front in the big cage. After a long day, there was nothing better than seeing those beautiful birds. Heck, they are the best thing about Miami for me. Food is second. Shuttle at 640 am was on time, driver was super helpful, all was good. I asked about the parrots and was told that they were gone because some guests complained about them. Huh? How crazy is that? Bring back the parrots, and I would make it excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TheDebsters
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a week. We were on a negotiated rate, so free breakfast (excellent buffet) and free internet. Cons - more outlets would be nice and the lamp next to the dresser had a missing on/off knob. I also wasn't too happy to order delivery and then have to go down and pick it up, but I guess that's a safety thing? The parking lot is a BIT close. Watch when you pull in and out of your parking space. The planes are noisy, but you ARE across from the airport. Pros - excellent service. Folks will go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and satisfied. Some poster complained about the maids speaking Spanish - for good grief! You are in Miami! I needed another bar of soap and was able to get my point across - I got my soap with no drama. I'd love to stay there again, but I believe the client has made other arrangements. Shame; I did like the hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “An old Aiport Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dado_de_Castro
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife after a long flight with a couple of problems after we got to MIA, so could not enjoy the hotel fully. We got a hotwire rate so we had a double room booked and they were not able to change it to a king room (more $) as they explained in a email. The room is very old, but the tv is brand new. We had a great night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty rooms make you sick.”
Reviews.Author: Med-Lynne
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed for a few nights and many left with sinus problems. The rooms are filthy, you lift a layer of dust when you run your finger across the furniture. The comforter was stained. Definitely not the place to stay if you have any respiratory challenges. It might just kill you. Aside from the Spanish speaking maids who can't speak NOR understand English (in an airport hotel???) the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Resort”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: Booked a night here due to a cancelled flight and after a long day involuntary in a rental car, it was a pleasant end of the day by staying at The Hilton Miami Airport. The hotel is almost like a resort at a peninsula, with several swimming pools, a nice garden, fitness center and other recreation activities. Even if it is so close to the airport and high ways, we didnâ€™t felt it disturbing with sound or the traffic. One of the best attributes itâ€™s the hotels staff, both at Front Desk and in the Restaurant. Had a late night meal in a nice setting and the waiter was more than pleased to give us advice and happy to make share orders. I recommend sharing the pizza with mozzarella, both cooked and served in an innovative way and really tasty. We came with a rental car and had a convenient parking just outside the hotel, at their secured own parking places. Unfortunately my rental car was from Avis, but I understood that if we should have a Hertz car we could just leaved it at the hotel (nothing else wrong with Avis â˜º) . There is also shuttle service to/from the airport, we didnâ€™t use that but we spoke to some compatriots in the (short) queue for check-in that was pleased over the service. Stayed in an Executive Room, nothing special, but clean and with a comfy bed. Perhaps I expected a little bit more upgraded amenities compared to other executive rooms by worldwide Hiltonâ€™s. It was not totally modern or with the latest design, but functional and efficient. No Executive Lounge with breakfast etc. but continental breakfast was offered in the restaurant that included everything you needed for a good start. The difference between the Full American Breakfast and the Continental was only the hot items. Overall â€“ well done Hilton and I should not doubt for a second to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Airport Miami hotel would be great if you just need a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Snorkeldawgs
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton Airport Miami hotel. We arrived after a very long day of travel. We were coming into Miami a day early prior to getting on a cruise ship. The hotel provided a free shuttle from the airport which we were told run every twenty minutes. We waited almost twice that until we were picked up. The hotel front desk staff were very friendly. The lobby was very nice looking. There was a nice bar area. The pool outside was very nice also pretty lagoon with Manatees. We were "upgraded" to the executive floor #13 & had a very nice smelling and clean room. The beds were very comfortable, the AC ran nice and cold. The room was very quiet besides hearing an occasional plane as the airport is right next door but that didn't bother us at all. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is the location. Everywhere we went we took a $30 something dollar taxi to. There is nothing withing walking distance to this hotel. It's a nice place to sleep but I would much have preferred staying downtown. We booked almost a year in advance & paid $150.00 plus an additional $20.00 something in taxes. There are much better deals to be found downtown, as friends of ours paid half of what we did & then saved on taxi fares as well...

Reviews.Title: “not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: ThemaiasSJ
Reviews.Content: Although this is an airport hotel the rooms have no safes. We were told we could use the safes at the front desk, but when we took our things there ,the safes were out of order. We asked if we could use the hotel's safe-"No" for practical reasons. No other suggestions. We had to ask to change rooms as when we enterered our assigned room, the ordor of cleaning products was overwheling. The fruit plate and water we had order online and had received an e-mail acknowledgement, had to be requested again. The room service tray whch we were told to put outside the door was still there 22 hours later. No newspaper the first morning. At 3.30 pm we had to stop a maid in the hallway and ask when our room was to be made up and she responded it wasn't on her list, and although she was through for the day, she would come to our room. (we tipped her generously) The waitress in the dinning room was very nice and we enjoyed the soup and salads buffet. Not what oe expects at a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “close but not quite”
Reviews.Author: CAevents
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in March. The first time was just a one night layover before an early morning flight the next day. When I walked into my room, I was shocked at how dirty and stained the carpet was. It's in need of refurbishment. Bathrooms are old and dirty. The sinks are low, with aged counters, tiles need replacing. I came back for a work meeting for 3 nights. The meeting rooms are varied to accommodate different set ups. The air walls separating the sections of the ballrooms are missing some pieces at the bottom, so if the group next to you is noisy it will filter through. The banquet chairs are older and need replacing. Cleanliness in the public spaces was an issue. They could do more vacuuming and general up keep. Staff was wonderful to work with. Banquet food was quite good. Restaurant and room service was average, nothing exceptional either way. They offer a complimentary shuttle from the airport. You have to stand on the outside curb at departure level and flag it down.

Reviews.Title: “Love the beds at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ringerb
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight before a cruise. Beautiful surroundings with the lake beside it. Everything in the room was good and well maintained. Lobby bar was understaffed so service was a little slow but the finger food was excellent. Table beside us complained of slow food delivery. We always love the beds at Hilton hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, great breakfast, poor dinner.”
Reviews.Author: OlavSundquist
Reviews.Content: Very 70th style Hilton hotel, with lots of concrete. Large room, no trouble with WiFi, but a bit smelly. Location near to the airport, but still needs a bus ride. Staff is very friendly. Swimming pool is fantastic!!!! XXXXLarge and outdoor! But the real reason to regularly return to the Hilton MIA is the breakfast: freshly made omelettes and pancakes, various fruits, and everything else you look for at a breakfast. On the other hand, the selection of dinner is quite limited: if you have a car to go elsewhere for dinner, the drive there - there are so many nice restaurants within 10 minutes drive. Overall a good choice to stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimhutch
Reviews.Content: having stayed here many times over the years either on the way in or out of Europe this Hotel will do exactly what it's meant to mainly give a base pre or post flight or cruise. It's unlikley that one would stay for more than a couple of nights but with an excellent airport bus conection (every 20m mins) for transit pu.rposes it works. breakast is the normal fare but chief Lilly has been there many years and will cook your eggs to perfection. The evenings can be a bit souless as there are not many resturant options nearby ,a cab to South Beach is an option. The vast pool area is ideal if you have some hours to kill in the sunshine before your flight.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: travelsavant
Reviews.Content: The good: convenient airport hotel, nice location on lagoon, free airport shuttle, 4* hotel amenities (room service, restaurant, bar, business center, pool, gym) The bad: very tired accomodations - some rooms are worse than others (downright shabby). No in-room hospitality bar on lower floors (have no idea why). Still has "smoking rooms" so some floors had lingering smell. No free WIFI. Was advised that renovations will commence this June but for visitors in next few months, be prepared that this hotel is not currently up to usual Hilton standards. Restaurant was good & public areas are in fairly decent condition. Won't be staying here again until AFTER renovation. Lots of other hotels close by that are much newer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Vinste
Reviews.Content: It s the second time we went to the Airport Hilton. the staff is verry nice and friendly ( both times ) the rooms are verry nice also. I like te price/quality. it s just next to the Dolphin x press way. just 10 mintutes from south beach by car.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: pablocruzer
Reviews.Content: The staff make this hotel worth considering. The location, especially if you like watching planes from the comfort of the pool, is attractive set in the middle of the Blue Lagoon; you're surrounded by water. Amazingly the aircon isn't on fiercely cold - just about right instead. The breakfasts are typical American but of good quality and again the staff are helpful, attentive and friendly. The bar area is always lively with non-residents too. The pool area and gym facilities are above average, clean with good quality water in the pool. Plentiful supply of fluffy white towels for free. Couple of downsides. Don't get a low number room 101, 201, 301 etc as they are next to the busy lifts. Also, don't expect to sleep in the day as the cleaning staff are noisy. Didn't see any airline crews staying, which was telling. A/c noise finishes late and starts early so ear plugs might be needed. Other than that at between $100 and $160 not bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Old run down hotel with pathetic bar service”
Reviews.Author: skippy090
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks nice enough from the outside but inside it is looking old and run down. Rooms are very basic. Hallways have a musty smell. Rates are quite expensive - overpriced for what you actually get. Conference facilities are very old - the noise from the gardeners meant we needed to take unscheduled breaks. Bar staff are pathetic - very slow, no personality and charge 18% tip in advance, then state on the bill that tip was not included when it actually was. Painfully slow internet connection - timeouts and not good enough for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and extra costs for basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: StairsOnly
Reviews.Content: The one night stay was disappointing from the price perspective. I thought I was saving over the nearby Hyatt Summerfield but the stay came out to about $219 a night. They charged me for parking and Internet Service and breakfast was not free. The room was clean and comfortable. The front desk was not very friendly as I would have expected, redirecting me to the hotel phone to make a reservation instead of just making it themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and services for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: kingrichard146
Reviews.Content: We utilized this Hilton for the second time in a year for a 1 night stay prior to boarding our cruiseship. The location is only 5 minutes from the airport and 20 minutes from the port. They have a pre-cruise package that includes breakfast and transfer to the port. The price is lower than staying downtown or the beach without cab ride costs. The rooms are available with king size bed and all amenities. The breakfast is a buffet with very large assortment of dishes for all tastes. Very sound proof rooms so you cant hear planes landing nearby. There is a large pool and garden area if you want to swim or sunbathe. Lobby is large and many groups pass through for cruises.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF”
Reviews.Author: ironworker752
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here thinking it was a nice place. The Lobby was nice, the room was large, we could hardly see out of the windows (they were so dirty). No free internet ($12.95 per 24 hours) All 800#s are to be free, so they say. Our phone bill the next day was $13.00 No where close by to eat , the dinning room in the Hotel opened at 6, bring your money, lots of it. The staff at the front desk were not very friendly or helpful. The FREE ride to the airport, which was the only thing that was free, was like running a race, I think the driver thought everyone on his little bus were late for something, he drove like a fool. Also wasn't very friendly. I do not like to be nickle and dimmed to death and so I would truly never recommend this place to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but don't order pizza from outside”
Reviews.Author: AFamilyAdventurer
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided a (free) shuttle from Miami airport and a (reasonable fee) shuttle to the cruise ship terminal. We didn't find any problems with rude staff as others have written here, but I do want to warn about a pizza place, which had slipped a menu under our room door. We got the impression from this that the hotel had allowed this and, being tired from our flight, ordered pizza and a meatball sub. Both were the worst such items we had ever had in our lives, no lie. And, we found not one, but three large hairs on two different slices of pizza. I paid the delivery guy with credit card, which he wrote down with a pen. I later found out someone had stolen out credit card and tried using it sevveral times in Miami that week. I can't prove they did it, but we didn't use the card anywhere else in Miami. Anyway, we mentioned the bad pizza to a hotel employee, and he said this outfit is not sanctioned by the hotel, and in fact the hotel has been trying to stop them, and they have still been slipping menus under doors even with security cameras in place. So, the fact that this can happen, with a bad neighborhood not far away, does raise some security concerns. Since we had to pick up the food at the concierge desk, it seems it would be easy enough for them to catch these guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: art_nouveau_5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for a short transit in Miami. The airport and seaport are both easy to get to. There are lots of stores nearby for last minute purchases. It also has great highway connections if you are trying to get to/from other parts of Florida. In and out parking privileges are available for $15 per day (plus tax). The room was very comfortable and quiet despite the proximity to the aiport (runways clearly visible from the room). There is an outdoor pool and a well-appointed bar area. There are also a couple of dining options onsite. The breakfast buffet is overpriced, but there are other options (a la carte or cafe).

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, filthy, with BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: jdpill
Reviews.Content: Was happy to get a decent deal on a "4 star" hotel - hilton no less. Entered to a very nice lobby with semi-pleasant desk service. But that's where it ended. The whole decor and overall look (once you get past the lobby) hasn't been updated since it was first built ages ago. The hallways were dark and dirty. Opened the door to the room and were appalled. The bathroom was filthy (dirty tub, floor hadn't been cleaned in who-knows-when, shower was cracked, etc). The bed and sheets were hardly thrown in place, and had stains. Worst of all, we woke up 4 in the morning, and found *BED BUGS* crawling on our clothes. You couldn't pay us to stay here again. I'd rather stay in a cheap motel - and this should not be marketed as a Hilton, or a 4 star. Shame shame. ps. and what hotel in 2010 charges you $$$ to use the wifi internet?! Parking was $15 a night

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY VERY VERY POOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: fluffybunny666
Reviews.Content: Long wait for shuttle after a long flight, checkin ok, room ok but average. Horrible staff attitude on room service phone. Breakfast worse than Macdonalds (steamed bacon) what's that about ? Desk staff rude then rude again and to top it off rude some more. Wrote to manager and invited comments on our stay --not a word from him , guess i'm in a queue As you can tell very unhappy with this hotel and what a price !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Hilton”
Reviews.Author: trekker14Medellin
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Hilton member and I stayed at this hotel because of the (supposed) convenience. I arrived into Miami at 8:30 PM with my 6 year old son and had to wait nearly 45 minutes (I knew they picked up on the second floor) before the shuttle pulled up. The driver stopped to go talk with a young woman he knew who was waiting at one of the pickup zones, I guess he had a different opinion on what the zone was for. We finally arrived at the hotel and were greeted less than pleasantly by the front desk (no one else was waiting). We asked about a place to eat, my son was hungry, and were told that we could get a snack in the bar. We waited for 10 minutes without anyone seeming to care that we were there, finally walked out, figured we'd try room service (nothing is nearby and there isn't any vending machines). Got to the room, it smelled awfully like perfume or something, and requested another room. Nothing available. The TV was not working (they told me it would be half an hour, it never worked before we went to sleep) and the Kid's hamburger was only $5.00, plus a $5.00 delivery fee + 22% room charge. We had no option but to do this as my son was hungry and we had a 6:40 flight the next morning. Took 40 minutes, now it's nearly 10:30, and the hamburger was awful. The next morning they missed the wakeup call, it was a good thing I had put something into my iphone to wake me up. BOTTOM LINE: This is an AWFUL hotel, and that is from a person who spends about 60+ nights per year (many in Hilton's) in hotels. If you have a family don't stay here, the hotel in the airport is similarly overpriced and awful, but at least you can be there in 10 minutes and walk down to the departure check in area for McDonald's or something. DON'T STAY AT THIS HILTON!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, tired and inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: LeavingOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: Hilton Diamond member who stayed here for 5 nights. Was assured I had a quiet room but had to move at 1.30 am because of the rumble of the planes. Carpets had stains, lights/phones didn't work; windows were dirty; aircon was out of the 70s - quiet depressing really. Came back one night and found housekeeping had not closed my door after servicing the room (luckily nothing was missing). Reported this to the manager. He didn't seem to care. This place is good for one night but don't stay for longer. Diamond members shouldn't expect any special treatment

Reviews.Title: “Seriously good.”
Reviews.Author: anothernightaway
Reviews.Content: Arrived deadbeat from transatlantic crossing. Boy was I glad to be staying here. Hilton bus picked me up from the Airport and delvered me to the door. Checked in and immediately felt comfortable. This is a larger hotel with a lot of staff available at all times. Great outside terrace to enjoy a cocktail or discuss business. Friendly staff at the bar served good bar food and knew their cocktails. Front of house staff especially good and very slick, obviously used to dealing with tired travellers. Ended up being upgraded as there were a couple of minor issues with my first room and always felt I could summon help easily. Great views from the upper floors to a distant Miami skyline!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rater1
Reviews.Content: I didn't have the issues others seemed to have had. Checked in at about 6 p.m. after attending a trade show downtown. Bellman was very helpful. It was great they have a Fedex box there. Concierge will help ship larger boxes via Fedex as well. As a gold HHonors member, I get free Internet access and was upgraded to the executive floor. Room was nice. Didn't have time to use gym or pool but they looked real good. Dinner in restaurant was good. Menu was a little limited. Didn't opt for the buffet but it looked decent. Airport shuttle runs frequently even very early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service...overpriced on everything....filthy filthy filthy!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megryan11
Reviews.Content: The staff is horrible to work with completly unprofessional!! We were told we could have an early check in and were stunned when they charged us an additional night stay for the early check in. 10am is a little early but not worth $127!! Got to our room and found that my shower curtain was covered in soap scum and mildew! We were here in a Group of about 45... And NO ONE was pleased. My brother and his wife were getting married that weekend and the staff was consitantly rude to them. They were charged twice for their stay at $400 a pop. When they asked why? They were told to come back in two days because no one was available to talk to them. Everything was overpriced and the Rooms are outdated and filthy! The only positive is the pool area.. But the pool bar closed at 3pm on a Sat. Night. Such a disapointing stay. :(

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for transit passengers”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while on transit. Great value for money at 65 usd per night. Room of good size. The smoking room smelled of smoke (of course), but was clean. For some reason, we were assigned an accessible room and that looked weird to us, even though it's nice to know that they have facilities for people really needing them. The room has a nice 42" plasma tv as well. There are a number of eateries around and it is easy to get food delivered, which is good. The swimming pool, while not really clean, was nice and spacious. All the outdoor area and the bar by the pool looked pleasant to spend time chilling. There is a gym that, although small, looked functional and new enough. All in all, a pleasant stopover and a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke & Mirrors”
Reviews.Author: Allan_in_NC
Reviews.Content: What a colossal rip off! Hilton may be on the door but it's all smoke and mirrors. I got to this place via Hotwire but I won't make that mistake again. Sure the Hotwire price was cheap---$74/day---but that's just to suck you in to a fundamentally bad deal. The well appointed lobby tricks you into thinking you're in a 4-star hotel, but that's all smoke and mirrors. The minute you step into the elevators you get a sense that all is not right. Tired old wood paneling that has not been kept up and seen its better days 10-20 years ago. The hotel floor decor and upkeep is anything but 4-star. More like 2-3 star. Then there's the room itself. Stained carpet, tired old furniture, not a picture on the wall (remember, this is suppose to be 4-star) and an austere bathroom to say the least. It gets worse. $13/day to use the internet, $15/day to park your own car in an open lot, and $22 for the breakfast buffet in a restaurant I wouldn't write home about. To add insult to injury, the parking lot isles are so small (no doubt to cram in more suckers) it requires a 10 minute back-and-forth parking exercise to get your car finally in a spot----pray you don't clip another car in the process----and for this they charge you $15/day! Need a nice place to stay near the Miami airport? There are plenty of other places nearby rated 3-stars that offer free parking and free Internet and are not worn out and worn down like this Hilton---and you won't have to pay $22 to eat breakfast either!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice pool, but needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: mrd232
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business last week. The hotel was convenient to customers I was visiting and of course, convenient to the airport, which was a huge plus. I had some time to check out the pool, which was wonderful, and virtually no one at it. The restaurants within the hotel had so-so service. The bartender was great; the wait staff, not so much. The rooms were okay, but looking a bit tired. I've been in nicer Hampton Inns, room-wise. The front desk was pleasant, the value was great - $120/night, and other than the tired decor, the place was nice and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good practical one night stopover”
Reviews.Author: ivorypen
Reviews.Content: We had to spend a night in Miami between 2 flights and found the Hilton to be a practical option. We stayed in a king bed suite, nice decor, very comfy bed, bathroom could be better but was adequat. (suite 750, away from airport and pretty quiet) Shuttle service was good and reception efficient, all requests made upon booking were met. The pool area was a nice place to relax after a long flight from UK. The experience was good enough and we booked the same room for our overnight stay on our way back. The food side was not great and could be improved but if it's not good value for money it's not the worst ever either. Breakfast is ok and certainly much better quality/value than whatever is on offer at the International airport.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: meccanaje
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and the staff was helpful...we arrived early from our cruise and they held our luggage while we went to the Miami Seaquarium. When we got back we got our room and luggage then dressed to get into that beautiful pool and hot tub that we enjoyed fully!!! Our morning flight was 6am and the shuttle was there...one issue my son left his cell phone and PSP under his pillow...security retreived both and we are patiently waiting for FEDEX to delover...Thanks security and hotel staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaureenHerts
Reviews.Content: We spent one day here, waiting for our flight home in the evening. It was very reasonable and the pool was great fun. The best bit was the airport shuttle. The very pleasant driver asked us which airline we were travelling with and then took us right to the door, with no charge. These shuttles go every 20 minutes. You can print off your boarding passes easily. The restaurant was unexciting but acceptable, even if the service was slow. The bedroom and bathroom were clean. It was a good place to sit out a 7 hour wait between flights. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stage for a cruise the night before”
Reviews.Author: KiloTango
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here with our two kids arriving late at night the day before we were scheduled to go on a cruise. Got a great rate (125/night) for the four of us including breakfast. Room was clean and new, hotel was convenient to the airport and only a $24 cab ride to the pier.

Reviews.Title: “A great business hotel for Miami trips”
Reviews.Author: moaksey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in July as I had a meeting by the airport. I hired a car as I had other meetings in Hollywood and Fort Lauderdale too. The hotel is easy enough to find and very close to the airport. The lagoon area it is situated in is great - doesn't feel like you're by an airport. The neighborhoods around MIA are pretty horrible so this really is an oasis. It is very well connected by road and I drove around with ease - always finding the hotel on the way home. Overall the hotel is very tired and in need of an overhaul. It feels very much like an 80s hotel - although being an airport hotel you can forgive it somewhat. The staff make up for this though and service was amazing - from reception to restaurant - they were all superb. The rooms are good - but also need a refurb. The beds are great and incredibly comfortable. I had no problems getting to sleep. I had a runway view (on request) but the noise was no problem. I used the fitness facilities/gym twice and although small it was well-equipped. The machines were new and it was very clean. I used the half-mile running track which goes around the hotel and it was fantastic! Felt very tropical. The pool looked good although I didn't use it. The tourists who did use it seemed to be happy enough. The restaurants were great. Breakfast and lunch was a good experience - although I would have appreciated more healthy options (maybe it was my choice). The hotel bar was good enough - the barman was very friendly and chatted to everyone. Here they could really do with more healthy food options though! I had to pay extra for parking and for internet access, which was a pain. Internet really should be free in hotels these days... It isn't the year 2000 any more! Overall I had a great business trip here. I doubt I'd stay here as part of a vacation trip, but if I come back again for business the hotel will be top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Hilton MIA airport”
Reviews.Author: MaryGoody
Reviews.Content: We really had no expectations when staying over night near the airport for an early flight. This hotel went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. Since we were Hilton club members, they gave us a beautiful room, with excellent view, free internet and airline points. This hotel is like a resort with a huge pool and lovely water view even though it is right next to MIA airport. Definitely recommended for the MIA layover.

Reviews.Title: “If your looking for a day room prior to flying home then this is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: JUVENTUS73
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a day room as we were due to fly home back to London in the evening. It was excellent. We were able to use the swimming pool and even played tennis and basketball on their roof top facilities. Yes of course you have the rumble of planes right next to you (across the road is Miami airport) but for use of the room as a day room for freshning up etc it was superb. The staff were friendly and the room was great. The bathroom was also stocked with nice shower gels and creams (Crabtree and Evelyn "La Source" Products) Definitely worth booking this hotel for a one day/night stop over. Good value for money and they run free transfers to the airport and back

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, next to airport”
Reviews.Author: Mikegoto
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good location for people who want to move. You are next to every highway so easy to go anywhere. The breakfast is great, lots of choice and very good service! Large rooms very nice equiped. We had view on the pool, so that was nice. The only negative point maybe is that you have a lot of extra charges: parking, internet, breakfast... so the additional cost reases the price of the room much higher

Reviews.Title: “Just another airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vikrant
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, the dining facilities adequate, the service good, the exterior like any other rundown apartment block in Miami This is an out and out business hotel, they charged phone calls to my room that I didn't make but took them off when I protested, the concierge gave me really boring options for travelling around, the food they served during business meetings was average Hilton should re-brand this hotel to a Hampton Inn or one of its lower end brands - because it is nothing like how Hiltons usually are, but one of the multitude of personality less, mundane airport hotels all over the US of A meant for business travellers to check into their rooms, unpack , go off to meetings or attend the conference in one of its meeting rooms, have dinner outside on an expense account, and come back to sleep off the martinis/ or whatever their choice of poison may be. Of course I would recommend it to a fellow business traveler - if he had to stay near the airport, did not have any business in downtown to attend to, wanted to pay a 100 bucks to get to Miami nightlife and generally wanted to ensure his Hilton Honors card maintained its elite level status

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad but...”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: Ihad a great pre-paid rate for $89 so I felt I had nothing to lose as i was concernd about some of the reviews on here. But for the most part it was not bad at all. The pool area was very nice, my room was very clean, check in/out was fast, and the location was great. My only complaint was that the concierges couldn't have cared less in making recommendations and almost seemed like they didn't know the town or area they worked in.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: icerider82
Reviews.Content: This was the last part of our honeymoon. It's a good hotel but realy made for a business stay. It's a huge hotel. The rooms where O.k. but you do have a lot of noise from the airplanes departing the airport. We stayed here one day before we flew back home. The restaurant is nice and the prices are not too high. just a nice, clean and o.k hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tough Review from a Diamond member”
Reviews.Author: grapdad
Reviews.Content: Boy, for the first time, I'm sorry i didn't read the reviews on this hotel before I stayed. We were here last night for one night prior to leaving for Key West this morning. If I had read the reviews I would have gone elsewhere. The room was small, and I was not upgraded to a suite. The Executive Room has no food or drinks. We received two Continental Breakfast coupons, and I am paying $12 for an 11 Mbps connection to the Internet, sitting in the lobby, since I can't get cconnected in my room. We are leaving after breakfast and not coming back. There are several other Hilton properties nearby, and would suggest that you check them out. The one good thing was Maurice in the Cove Bar. What a great bartender! Great cocktails. The appetizers, which were free, were ghastly. Sorry Conrad, but this place needs some help.

Reviews.Title: “Close to being there, but not quite.”
Reviews.Author: TracyLeeSherles
Reviews.Content: Last minute confirmation and checked into a full hotel. However, the room smelled like extreme incense and the bathroom was not clean. It appeared to be pretty sloppy. Additionally, the card was not programmed for the parking lot machine. That is frustrating when you are trying to leave the parking lot. The other issue that became very aggravating was the lack of coffee cups in the automatic coffee maker!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....Close to Airport....Beautiful Pool Area and Walking Path”
Reviews.Author: Jetdriver11
Reviews.Content: Typical Hilton property....Rooms are OK, most have not been updated in a while. The Suites are nice and more updated at least with on LCD TV. Staff can be hard to work with and need to be bit knowledgeable. Service with the front desk and checking in prior to arrival has been extremely poor. The indoor and outdoor bar areas are nice with Madora being a star employee....always making everyone feel at home and comfortable. Nice walking path around the property and pool area. Restart is over priced and bland. The concierge lounge was taken out and a pay to play business center was installed that is truly one of the most absurd things I have ever seen at any hotel in all my travels world wide. Just in order to get online for 5 minutes and print out 5 pages of paper was going to cost me around $10.....when I have already paid $12+ for internet! Absolutely NOT for the business Travel.....Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Sleazy MIA Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElvisPWorldwide
Reviews.Content: After a zillion airport hotels in a zillion countries, Iâ€™ve seen pretty much everything. Hand in hand with that, Iâ€™ve come jaded to the point where I give a huge amount of leeway to the less than glamorous, which airport hotels typify. Letâ€™s face it, MIA airport hotels have never had a reputation for anything that resembles mediocre and arenâ€™t bagging may stars these days. Their reputation of indifferent service and sticky rooms is nothing new to business travelers. I mean if you have to stay over 24 hours, head to Bricklel, Doralâ€”anywhere but MIA and its offerings. The lone exception was always the Miami Airport Hilton. Good location, smart looking surroundings, the exotic birds greeting you in the lobby, a generous shot at the bar. If you had to stay at MIA, this was workable. Forget it. This last bastion of quality at MIA has joined the ranks of its peers and today would be lucky to eke out 2.5 stars. On my last two visits, I was greeted with sleazy shower curtains knee-high in mildew, 20 minute service at the bar by a yawning waiter, re-filled water in the mini-bar, used grounds in the coffee maker, dried coke on seemingly every horizontal service and of course, the requisite â€œMIA check-inâ€� which involves a line of at least 20 while one person performs the processing of the guests. The good news? Well I didn't catch any terminal diseases but with that shower curtain, it wasnâ€™t out of the question. So disappointing; this used to be a pretty spiffy place. Long gone, game over. And the birds are gone.

Reviews.Title: “worst Hilton I ever stayed at - believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: wherecanigo
Reviews.Content: I am a diamond member of HIlton and this is not only the worst Hilton I have ever stayed at but one of the worst hotels ever. I don't typically write reviews but I relied on trip advisor reviews and was very disappointed; dirty, old, gym lock was broken, food terrible. I am a 1k flier and as I said a diamond hilton member(the highest possible) so I have a lot of experience. Trust me on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and potentially expensive”
Reviews.Author: Adam20191
Reviews.Content: The hallways are nicer than the rooms themselves, which are clean, but old. Fifteen dollars for parking seems excessive, given the location. Also, a glass of milk from the bar cost more than $5.00. The breakfast buffet, however, was good. Bottom line: this Hilton is better than the Marriott I tried last time near MIA, but that isn't saying much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlosTCuracao
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there October and now again in February Great for business and for relaxing my favorite hotel in Miami

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Avkhusial
Reviews.Content: nice, big and very good. with pool. I was there while they were shooting Up in the Air. i saw Clooney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing! Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: CharmCity79
Reviews.Content: Hilton should be ashamed that their name hangs from this building. My wife and I stayed for one night recently because of the hotel's proximity to the airport and the Hilton name. MISTAKE. We started our stay with a long line to check in. Next, we entered the room... it was like entering the 1970's. The bathroom was outdated and dark, the TV was a barely-functional antique and the bed was very uncomfortable. Room service prices were outrageous (for soup, small salad, chicken fingers and two Coke's = $60) and the soup was the only thing with any taste. Price to park per night = $15. Airplanes taking off overhead were annoying. The remote control stopped working/batteries died and after 2 calls for help, nobody came so we gave up on the TV. A side note: the hotel (and Miami airport), are located in a HEAVY Spanish speaking area. I am not Spanish speaking. I ventured out to get a haircut, and on a short drive around town found that businesses were Spanish-only (even Supercuts did not speak English!). Also, parts nearby seemed less than friendly... I did not feel comfortable driving after dark. The only quality of this disaster of a hotel is it's close proximity to the airport. However, based on my experience I will avoid Hilton AND the Miami airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience at the Hilton Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: SJDJMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our recent cruise. After reading some of the reviews on this board I was wary, however we thought it was very nice. The lobby is huge, the view of Miami at sunrise was beautiful, the room was very nice, bed was comfortable, room was clean, and the planes didn't bother me at all...never heard them after 11 PM or so. We ate supper at the buffet Friday night. I believe it was $24 each but the food was good. The breakfast buffet is overpriced at $22 but the coffee shop has a great breakfast sandwich for $7 which was HUGE. Our experience here was a good one and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “$11.00 for a Bloody Mary that is overchargin in my optinion”
Reviews.Author: bendedi1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the idea of a free shuttle, but felt there were to many extra charges for things that I felt should be included. The pool area and gym were quite nice. The lounge was crazy expensive. I paid $11.00 for a small Bloody Mary. The hotel is away from shopping and they offered a shuttle to a mall for $10.00 per person return. Internet was $12.95 per 24hour period and the bottled water in the room was $3.25. It really just seemed like everything was so expensive and nothing included. The lobby area was nice but I think the overall hotel was just average. The rooms were quite plain with dull lighting. I thought being so close to the airport that we would here planes all night but it was quiet. We could however here a whistling noise when the neighbor would shower which was not so great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the airport, I had a better experience than most reviews”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: I ended up booking at the last minute on Superbowl Sunday after a flight weather delay because of the first snowpacalypse and was a bit wary. I have Hilton Gold and was upgraded to a suite that was lovely for no extra charge. All of the staff I encountered were courteous and helpful. The breakfast buffet (for $20 for two above the base rate when booking) was plentiful and with a good variety. The pool area and spa were very nice. It was a little noisy with all of the jubilant Saints fans, but I really can't complain about that. My only suggestion would be to have the airport shuttle come more frequently to the airport, we waited about a half hour. We had no delay in getting back to the airport the next day. I wouldn't stay there if I were vacationing in Miami, but it was perfect for our needs flying out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotel airports-needs a better bar area”
Reviews.Author: tripholic
Reviews.Content: Close to airport and highway. Reasonable parking charge and lots of different room choices. Great staff, especially events and banquets(held many meeting here). If you stay on the weekend, they have the best brunch in the area, come very hungry. There is tennis and basketball courts for a resort feel without the price. Pool area is large and tropical, with a bar on site. I wished they had a better bar area in the lobby, even though it it new. Overall, I have always been happy with this no nonsense stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worn hotel is best desciption”
Reviews.Author: sjrbt
Reviews.Content: I wanted a decent hotel for an overnight stay this month. The Hilton is rated a 4 star property on some websites and it is a high category for Hilton, so I thought I'd be realatively safe. The hotel is VERY worn. Our door knob was so broken apart, I doubt the locked actually worked and if it did all one had to do is push the door open because the molding was broken apart. We didn't have a fridge of mini bar in the room and there is NO restaurants or any life near the hotel. It is in a business park about 1 1/2 miles from the airport. We arrived late and were hungry and the late night menu at the hotel was abysmal. They were maybe, 10 items on the menu (wraps, salads) and they were out of 3 of my choices. I asked them if they could just send up some rolls with butter and a drink and they told me they threw the rolls out for the day. There was literally nothing to eat and no where to get it later in the evening. Breakfast the next morning was typical bad hotel food and the waitress overcharge us. I do not have a good impression of this hotel and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Isolated And Needs Renovation. Stay Away.”
Reviews.Author: sporock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in Mid-February, my company has an office on Blue Lagoon drive. Price: Although i got a corporate rate, this Hilton is way overpriced. The room I checked into had nothing more than the basics. The TV looked like it was manufactured in 1988, and the bathtub enamel was peeling in several spots. The health club was tiny, especially considering how many rooms this hotel has. I had to wait 20 minutes for a treadmill. Pool is small, jacuzzi was ok. Dinner inside the hotel was mediocre at best, and cost me over $45 for a plate with a drink. Location: Unless you have a car, you are out of luck. There is a strip mall that has a few small restaurants but is a 20 minute walk from the lobby. You also have to cross a highway to get there, rather unsafe - especially at night. Also, just keep in mind you are next to an airport. The planes are very loud, and take off every 5 minutes or so. I had lunch at the Sofitel which was a lot closer to everything, and looked much nicer. I only stayed here for the HHonors points. Stay somewhere else. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport, clean”
Reviews.Author: RooRoo8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night following our cruise. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly (our housekeeper on the 13th floor was great, we had no phone book, I bumped into her on my way to the front desk, she made a few calls and got me one). The lobby was a bit dated but for $110 a night it was fine by me. We ate dinner at the restaurant ($25 person for their buffet, was ok but nothing to write home about). Our rate included breakfast - also a buffet but we were told it included "cold food only" and did not include any of the eggs/pancakes/sausage etc. The shuttle runs every 20 minutes to the airport, it was on time, driver was friendly and we got to the airport w/in 10 minutes. As previous posters mentioned you are far away from pretty much everything here, located in a business park so if you have no rental car you are going to have to pay a taxi to get anywhere. When we got here we called a local pizza place who delivered a pizza for lunch (the concierge will help you with that). Within a week of getting home we went to see the movie "Up in the Air" and were pleased to see about 15 minutesof the movie was shot in the hotel lobby (it was easy to recognize given how dated it is) so that was a little bonus. Given its close proximity to the airport and the cleanliness and good price, I would stay here again. only downfall is the noise - we didn't hear the airplanes but we did hear other guests in the middle of the night as they walked up and down the halls (pretty loud).

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to have a drink or two!”
Reviews.Author: Bloomington-2
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for an overnight before a cruise. We had checked earlier in the afternoon if they would be open at the outside bar and turn on a NFL playoff game at the " Blue Lagoon bar", which she said yes . When we got there we asked twice to change the channel as the game was starting and ordered 1- Vodka/7. When she didn't turn the channel I just paid for my drink and decided to go to the inside bar where it was on. I'm not sure what was more IRRITATING paying $11.99 for a small drink in a plastic glass or missing the kick-off of the game.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from everything that you should stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: jjlr4
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights before our cruise. The lobby is cold and makes it very uncomfortable to sit in and eat breakfast. No executive lounge snacks as advertised. Hot tub was under repair. Had to rent a car to get anywhere which adds to your cost to stay. Plus they charge $15.00 a day for parking. Not worth it when you add in the cost of staying there. Room was fine and noise from planes were not a problem. Stayed on the executive floor. Suggest to stay where you can walk to restaurants or ones that have free shuttles. This is not a 4 star hotel, more in line with a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “DIAMOND VIP???? YOU MUST BE KIDDING!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a one night layover in Miami on December 22. It all started very well, the shuttle quickly showed up at the airport, but that was ALL of what I can positively say about this hotel. My husband travels a lot on business , so we have a Diamond Vip tier with Hilton's reward program. No trouble at all booking the reservation and redeeming points. Upon arrival we were given a room that was nice and clean, but that was it, nothing fancy, just a hotel room. I must say that if you do not have a rental car you are trapped, because there is absolutely nothing within walking distance, and the food at the hotel is very expensive. We found a display in the room that offered "In Room Pizza Party" for a LOT of money on a cheese pizza, but we were very tired after flying for 8 hours from Brazil , and we had no car, so my husband calls the front desk and orders the pizza. 50 minutes later and starving he calls the front desk again, only to find out the receptionist had misprinted our room number and the pizza had been sent back. WHAT????????????????? But it does not end here!!!!!!! The person at the front desk asked if we still wanted the pizza. We said, Of course, we are waiting for it! What did they send us???? The old, cold and horrible pizza that had been returned! We were so hungry we didn't have the strength to fight it, but we were so disappointed! 16 dollars for a cold pizza? You must be kidding me !My husband went down to the front desk and complained about it, all they said was they were sorry, but the pizza service was third party ( Pizza Hut) and there was nothing they could do. How can you treat guests like that? Was it because it was reward night and we were paying nothing? We were outraged! Sleeping at night if you are a light sleeper like me is very hard too. They gave us a room facing the runway at the airport, and there was the noise of planes coming up and down all night long. We are never going back to this hotel, it was one of the worst hotel nights of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: MarieMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Miami Airport from December 26th-January 2, as a pre-cruise stay. Travelled with family and teenagers. One of the best Airport hotels I have stayed in in Miami and we all agreed. We are avid travellers (anywhere from 3-5 times per year) and have high expectations when dealing with hotel standards. Let me tell you this was totally worth it. We booked a king Alcove room (slightly more expensive but TOTALLY WORTH it!) They have two alcove rooms per floor and have a living room/suite space. Decor is modern and beautiful, nothing like the other rooms at this hotel I have seen online. We were 8 in our room on new year's eve and could have easily fit another 8! The Alcove room with double beds (my teen's room) even had a wet bar!. Fantastic views and the lagoon setting is absolutely beautiful. If you don't like the sound of airplanes this is definately not the hotel for you, but we didn't mind it. Great location, heated pools (not all airport hotel pools are heated), great access to the airport and easy access to downtown. They accomodated an early check in. The housekeeper was extremely nice and polite! Can't remember her name but she is on the 14th floor. We have stayed at the Sofitel around the corner and no questions asked this one is fantastic! Never ate at the hotel, however every restaurant imaginable is around the corner including McDonalds and starbucks! Definately a fantastic stay! Would stay here again no questions!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BeachSuitesGM
Reviews.Content: Got ditched there by American Airlines so it was only a one night stay. I ate in the Cafe and the food was truly horrible and overpriced, service was even worse as it took 11/2 to get fed and it was only one course ordered. The sparse Lobby bar has limited selection and does not have proper sanitaion - no sink. Bedroom was large but very dated and the bathtub in 312 needs refinishing. Staff was friendly but they were short staffed the night I was there and no management. Bad News from a good brand.

Reviews.Title: “cmm on.. this is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoshosho
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. I paid $159/night for this crapy old hotel. I am a HH gold, but did not get any special treatments. the elevator was old, the staffs were not nice, and charge $20 for parking, $15 for internet. The main reason I booked this hotel was the location closed to the airport and being able to store my luggages for 6 days until I come back from Cancun. I booked this hotl for my return day as well. I called the hotel 3 months ago to confirm that I can store the luggages for 6 days. When I got there and tried to store the luggages, they said they changed the policy. they do not store the luggage for their customers any longer. So, I had no reason to stay this hotel after I come back from my Cancun trip. So I cancelled the reservation, and I stayed at DoubleTree. It is adverised as 3 star hotle, and it was much better than the Hilton. I paid $75 for this. In summary, this hotel is no worth more than $100 per night. I am not saying this because I am mad about their service. It is my honest opinion. 3 star hotel... no way. It is 3 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Quick access to Airport, decent quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: SunPrincess9000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here every time during our vacations to Florida. We usually stay at the Hilton our first night and our last night in Miami, as the location to the airport is so close. Getting there: Catch a BLUE cab from the airport ( they are the only ones allowed to go there) will cost about $14 US. A little steep, so wait/find the Hilton shuttle bus if you can. Its really less then a 5 minute ride. Hotel Property: As it is close to the airport you will hear hear some airport noises. We usually stayed on the "back" side of the hotel, overlooking the salt water lagoon, so the noise is less noticeable. Our most recent stay our room had us facing the airport, and I found myself waking up every 30 minutes when the jets would take off. The hotel is set nicely on a lagoon, with a short walk way to the point. The outdoor pool area was clean, though we never cold find a server to get a drink by the pool. The interior is well kept, with new carpets, and furniture though the huge lobby feels dated with the tinted windows and \white stucco. Hotel Rooms: If you can afford to, upgrade to the suites, with the living room area. These rooms are larger, and have been renovated with nicer curtains and furniture. One major plus for this hotel is the comfort of the beds- super quality . I am a pillow princess and I find the beds and linen to be amazing- a great sleep every time ( except for the jet thing) Hotel service: We have always been happy with the service here- friendly, prompt staff. They even sent up a wine and fruit platter for our honeymoon. Over all: This hotel is not the at the luxury level that Hilton usually has, but the rooms are clean, and the location cannot be beat if you are traveling to/from Miami international Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...barely a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBen98
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Miami in three weeks, with the last visit spent at the Intercontinental near the airport. Both Hilton & Intercontinental are classified as 4-star hotels, and I can assure you the Intercontinental is light years nicer than the Hilton. The staff @ Hilton is barely polite, parking is $15/day, internet is $12.95/day. The "balcony" is a 2 1/2 foot perch enclosed by a wall with nothing to even sit on overlooking the airport runway. The bathroom desperately needs updating. I've booked via Priceline for 4 days for a business trip and I so wish I could get my money back and go back to the Intercontinental. This place is disgusting, in spite of the lower Priceline rate. The Intercontinental was almost $50 less per night thru Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sueflorida
Reviews.Content: I am from London in the UK and wanted 1 night in a hotel after our flight to Miami before driving to Tampa the following day. I booked a one night stay through E- Bookers which was under Â£75 for 3 adults and included continental breakfast in a room on the executive floor. I then found out that the executive room had stopped serving breakfast and when I contacted the hotel manager Raul Aguilera, he was most obliging and assured me that continental breakfast would be included. We also had the option of receiving a $10 voucher each towards a full breakfast if we wished. We arrived at 3.30pm and were dealt with promptly and courteously at check in. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony on the 13th floor well away from the elevators. We had a view of the lagoon and the airport runway and soon got used to the noise of the planes which wasnâ€™t overbearing. There was a dog in the room opposite who barked when we opened our doors but didnâ€™t make a sound afterwards. Personally I am not mad keen on dogs in hotels and presume they only occupy certain rooms. However this dog did not disturb us. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. The beds were the most comfortable that we have ever slept in. OK the communal areas were cooler but certainly not of Antarctic proportions as indicated by others. All prices for the mini bar and the bottled water were labelled in the bedroom. The meal we had in the bar area was pleasant and not outrageously expensive. The staff were attentive without being pushy or overbearing. The breakfast was excellentâ€”fruit juice, coffee, a wide choice of fruit, buns, cake, soft cheese, yoghurt, toast, croissant. The only thing we couldnâ€™t have access to was cereal. The hotel was spotless and nicely decorated and with an excellent location. We got a taxi to Dollar car rental for $13-30.The taxis are all lined up in the parking lot so there was no hanging around. The hotel has several areas that you can relax in giving a degree of privacy and it is tastefully decorated and most comfortable. The elevators were spacious and efficient. If I was staying for more than 1 night, I would probably ask for a room which was at the back of the hotel overlooking the Miami skyline which wouldnâ€™t get any aircraft noise.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to 4-star!”
Reviews.Author: mickey79ar
Reviews.Content: The parking lot was very tight and not conducive for driving in both directions, without almost running into another car. The ice machine was hidden and took about 10 minutes to find (thought it was another hotel room). The remote batteries were dead and there were only two plugs in the room accessible. The bathroom resembles something out of your local low budget hotel. Not even close to being considered 4-star. The television was horrible and each time you would change the channel the volume would reset itself. There was no refrigerator in the room and they only offered Zephyrhills water, rather than Fiji, like most hotels in this caliber. I would definitely not recommend staying here, especially for the high price and the $15 a day parking charge. I would have been happier at a 2 or 3 star hotel, where parking was free and I knew what to expect for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure in Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: JAGGLADY
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel except the location! I had to take taxis everywhere which became costly but worth it. I have no complaints and can't wait to stay at another Hilton in the near future!!!! A+++++ The scenary was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: luckymaaa
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel, quick check in. Room ok, but very dusty, looked as the room was not in use for a long time... carpet not very clean. Nice pool area. Booked this hotel due to the arrival time and had to pick up the car next day at the airport. So if you need a bed at the airport its ok.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Grisgrisca
Reviews.Content: Although I was a little aprehensive having read the reviews, I was extremely pleased with this hotel. I realize I had an unusually low room rate but nevertheless the value was outstanding especially for a cost per night that I paid of under $100. There is ample parking which was free although the desk indicated that there was now a charge of $15 per night..it was waived on check-out. The double-bedded room was the utmost in comfort, especially the bed, and totally quiet despite the proximity of Miami airport. Staff and service were excellent and very pleasant at all times. The entry to the parking is controlled by the room card and I had no problems with security and I noted hotel security continually checking the parking which is right in front of the hotel. Best of all is that although close to the airport the hotel is nicely situtated on a lagoon and is well lanscaped and the pool area is very pleasant. For jogging there is the path around the grounds as well as donw the street past several well-landscaped condo buildings and corporate headquaters (e.g. Burger King). Of course having a car is a major advantage as leaving the hotel it is only a short drive to the main highway leading directly to the oceanfront. All in all a very pleasant surprise and reassures my long-time positive experience with Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, but freezing”
Reviews.Author: markush4t
Reviews.Content: Nice Hilton with a big parking lot and excellent views from the rooms. As with any other Hilton: *Why do they need to cool down the lobby and breakfast room to Antarctic temperatures? *Why does every Hilton CHARGE you for internet? *And why do they make such a fuss about â€œcontinentalâ€� and â€œintercontinentalâ€� breakfast?
