Reviews.Title: “Overpriced: avoid restaurant if you can. Ridiculous HH benefits.”
Reviews.Author: brunneng
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 8 months earlier and found it agreeable enough to book it again for a layover. However, in January I had booked one of their suites, and now - traveling alone - I had opted for a "normal" room and optional paid upgrades. The normal rooms are a bit shabby. The bathroom is dated but clean, the bed comfortable and clean, an old TV, and a minibar I didn't manage to open. My main complaints that every traveller might care about are that while there is nowhere to go in the area, the hotel has one restaurant which is ridiculously overpriced, and one breakfast kiosk of the same ilk. Imagine paying 18 Dollars for 2 glasses of yoghurt with some fruit and granola and a cappuccino - self service, too! However, the restaurant exhibits a Hilton award document for winning 2008's "profit maximizing" challenge. I will believe it. The pool area looks nice, but what are you going to do there in the evening - their outside bar is closed. The gym is nice - as it's not in some basement, but near the pool area, it has a view which is rare. For those who care about the HH benefits (Gold), I have the feeling that Hilton generally gets stingy, but Miami..! no room upgrade (crappy room), not even a paid upgrade, (and I book through Hilton.com) and only a 10 Dollar voucher for breakfast which gets you a self service cappuccino and probably a bagel without anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Reception”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaBrazil
Reviews.Content: We had just arrived from a 8 hour trip from Brazil and as we entered the room we were surprised by a tray with different kinds of cheese, crakers, fruits and sparkling wine. It was just heaven for a very exhausted couple. The front desk was nice enough in giving us driving directions to a restaurant we were looking for. There is a coffee shop in the premises that allows you to have someting to eat rather than full breakfast or buffet. As we stayed for only one night and arrived late, we discovered late at night that our TV had some kind of problem that enabled us of watching it. All the rest was just fine. The location is good if you have business in the area or if you're stuck in Miami beacause of a flight delay because it is far from any tourist attraction, shops or restaurants. There is a car rental on the premises that has much cheaper rates if you spend a night there.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PocherMilan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been to this Hilton hotel about an year ago. We've stooped there more than we planned due to the hurricanes in the Keys. The room was nice and quite big, the one we got was divided in two parts:one with the sofa, a tv and a desk and one with the bed and another sofa...the view wasn't excellent but not too bad either. The main thing that we really didn't like was the temperature inside the hotel: it was absolutely freezing!!We couldn't go around with short sleeves without being cold!We firstly thought it could have been us, but almost all the other customers in the hotel complained about that. The food was ok but too expensive and we remember talking with a couple of people of the bar and the restaurant not being able to speak English very well. The shuttle from the airport is useful even if the service is not that great. It's ok to stay there one night but we probably wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelinboo
Reviews.Content: I bid on the hotel thru Hotwire and it was listed as a four star hotel. I found out our flight was delayed so I called them to tell them and asked about availability of King sized beds. I was told there were plenty available and I would have to take a taxi because the shuttle stopped running at 1:00am. When we checked in we were told that the room they assigned us was 2 double beds. When I told her that we had been told that we called and were told that we had a king sized bed. She told me that we could upgrade for $20. I couldn't believe it. I did not want to upgrade for a hotel I already paid for. So we started our romantic anniversary trip sleeping in different beds. The next day I called Hotwire and the very nice customer service rep tried calling the front desk. They were very rude to her as well. The room was very outdated and gross. A motel room instead of a 4 star hotel. Warning! Do not stay at this hotel! You will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for the Offered Product”
Reviews.Author: Jim3231
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be removed from the Hilton system. The hallways carpet is dirty and bubbled; the wallpaper stained and peeling. Guestroom carpet was badly stained. Service at the restaurant was very poor; prices for the food too high for the quality of their product. The pool area was nice and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: Leadbelly98
Reviews.Content: This Hilton looks old and out-dated from the outside but the interior is quite nice. We stayed in a lagoon-view room that was clean and well-kept each day by the housekeeping staff. Our stay was during the low-season for southern Florida. Below are the positives and the improvement areas: +) large swimming pool with ample number of lounging chairs +) flat-panel TV with several HD channels +) located close to the Miami Int'l airport and a Publix grocery store +) a well-kept exercise room that is a bit small for the size of this hotel -) failed to inform guests that the executive floor & lounge were under construction -) A/C unit was weak and could not keep our room cooler than 72F -) slow-responding engineering staff as it took the hotel 24 hours prior to fixing the TV in our room.

Reviews.Title: “No better view in Miami”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: When you see "Airport" in the name of a hotel, you tend to get nervous. High traffic, marginal service, and beds that should have been thrown out years ago. However, none of those things apply to this wonderful Hilton property. The rooms are bight and airy, and the bathrooms are clean. The real gem though is the view! My room looked over the International terminal and runways at Miami International, as well as a beautiful lagoon below, and the city of Miami in the distance. The food from room service was good. Not the greatest selection in the world, but what they offered was good. When I did have an issue, I contacted the hotel's General Manager Raul Aguilera, and it was addressed it right away, making me feel like I mattered as a valued customer, not just a body warming a bed. This goes for the entire staff, who were friendly, helpful and always ready with a smile and willingness to assist. This will likely become my new home away from home in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: walNorthAmerica
Reviews.Content: I regret staying here. Dumpy rooms, unclean, hairs in bathroom, rundown everything. A gym too small to call a gym. Bad overpriced food. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Stops Running @ 1am”
Reviews.Author: kkasten
Reviews.Content: Well, this was a short stay and ever shorter than origianally anticipated. Our flight from DFW was delayed which got us in about 2 hours later than we should have been. When we got off the plane and headed down to get on the tranport from the airport to the hotel we found that they stopped running at 1am. WHAT!?! So, we had to pay a cab $14 to drive 1.2 miles. I was very upset. When we got to our room they had everything ready for us as requested but the bathrooms were small and for the price we paid I would've of stayed in a motel 6 for the 3 hours of sleep we got.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chenaira
Reviews.Content: The hilton is a nice hotel. I've been here for a long weekend thursday till monday. The rooms are big enough. There is a tv and a fridge but you have 2 pay for the fridge to use it. Tip: We went to the supermarket a few blocks up and bought some bread for in the morning en some drinks. Our room was on the 5th floor and there was icemachine in the hallway that was verry handy for our drinks ;) The hotel is 5-10 mins from the airport. Free shuttle busses picks you up. If you want to party, shop or go 2 to the beach i would advise you to stay closer 2 south beach unless you have a car. If you have a rental you are there in about 15 mins. From hilton hotel there are no busses going straight to south beach. It is possible but first you have 2 take de free shuttle at the hotel to the airport and there you have to transfer 2 another bus that can take you to south beach it will take you like 45 min but you will pay only 2.50 dollars If you take the taxi from the hotel to south beach you will pay one price 32 dollars oneway. Another tip book your rental with the hotel because if you gonna rent it there you are gonna pay more!!! I would recommend this hotel only if you would like to be close to the airport. In my case it was better if i stayed in south beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Layover at Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: jfoote
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Airport Hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport. My wife and I stayed one night at the conclusion of a cruise. It is a large hotel on the water with a beautiful view of Miami. The room was large with adequate amenities but was beginning to show some wear. If the price is right, this would be a good choice for a layover.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel! Everyone who is tired from a long trip can relax here!”
Reviews.Author: marthadumfries
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and comfortable hotel; I couldn't go on friday to Aruba so I stayed in this hotel. I liked the service, the food, and the people, oh especially ms Argentina and mr Cuba from the restaurant. I was very tired from my trip...so it was for me a good choice to stay at the Hilton hotel. I recomend everybody to stay there if you can. ms Swinda Dumfries, May 16, 2009

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lar5284
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Hotel does not match the standards of the Hilton Hotel chain. The rooms are old, there is a lack for service to Gold and Diamond members, and the staff does not seem to be trained for higher standards. Electric outlets at room didnot work, and misssing light bulbs in some lamps. Linens were just OK. THe food at the restaurant is mediocre, and not even worth it's value.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: mbph2001
Reviews.Content: This Hotel looked really beautiful from the lobby, but when you get to the rooms, it's a total different story. The bathroom had hair all over the floor and in the tub, no soap; I had to call to get some and extra towels. No ironing board and could not reach housekeeping to get the ironing board the next morning. The carpet was stained no bags in any of the trash cans, this Hotel should not be a Hilton. Oh, and to make it worse, I had to pay $15.00 extra just to park my car in the parking lot. Oh, if I wanted to eat their continental breakfast, it was $10.00 per person and $20.00 per person for the American breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand why this is still called Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: juliaxix
Reviews.Content: Terrible quality. Good location if you need to get to the airport in the morning, but it is not that quick to leave the car park if you're in a rush! The parking ticket you take when you drive in is taken away from you at the check in desk. The staff is claiming that your room card will open it. The thing is, it does not. You end up at 5am running back and forth from the gate to the hotel lobby to try to somehow unlock the damn gate. Very frustrating. Only 1 staffer at 5am at check-in desk. too busy to handle the checking out, and the currently staying in the hotel upstairs. Oh, and you pay extra for WiFi. Swimming Pool outside, but didn't dare to go there. Room - dirty, bathroom, dirty. Do not ever stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay 2 nites and loved it ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: HaveJaysWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Cruise departed Sat and we spent Thur & Fri nites at the airport Hilton. We figured we should allow some time in case our luggage was lost and SURE ENOUGH , that's exactly what happened! So glad we had the extra time before the cruise. The King Suite was very comfortable and an excellent value! It was a corner suite so it had lots of windows and a HUGE balcony! If you love watching planes this room's for you. Although you hear some roar when on the balcony, the room itself is very quiet. Suites on the opposite end of the hotel will have views only of the lagoon. The suite was clean, the bedroom had door to separate it from lvng rm. The bed was very comfortable with superb linen. The vanity area separate from tub / throne room. (Oddity with toilet paper ... it was located on wall, but only a foot off the floor so made me laugh) The King Suite comes with access to Executive lounge; snacks were kind of chintzy, (chips, fruit, cheeses, crackers) alcohol beverages were $6.00, pop, juice, bottled water free. We never went for free Continental breakfast. We will DEFINITELY stay at this hotel again. Shuttle from airport was free and just $12.00/person to Miami port. The Hertz car rental was on site in hotel (ease of pickup and dropoff). The Concierge was TREMENDOUS particularly with situation with lost luggage. Our dinner in the restaurant was tasty and reasonably priced; gift shop was quite small, ATM on site. Outside, there were plenty of deckchairs, hottub, pool, poolside bar, and nicely manicured grounds. There was a promenade around the property which invited evening strolls around the lagoon. It felt totally safe as there was video surveillence. The gazebo at the end of the peninsula was very romantic. I can hardly wait to go back. It was hard to believe we were near an airport and close to downtown Miami. Be sure to check out my photos!

Reviews.Title: “bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: plasticsurgeon8
Reviews.Content: the lobby beatiful , the pool beatiful, the room is old.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingcrocodile
Reviews.Content: roomy and comfortable rooms (we had the alcove room) for the 4 of us, i.e. parents and 2 kids. Convenient because close to the airport (and we DO like to watch planes take off), nice pool area that is never croweded (my children got to see their very first iguana there), surrounded by a laguna. Very quiet considering you are next to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if you need to be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: RobuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we got a cheap rate, wanted a pool and wanted to be close to the airport to catch our flight the next morning. Free shuttle to the airport. Papa John's pizza delivers to the hotel. Lots of people doing the same thing judging by how full the shuttle was in the morning. All in all an easy finish to our vacation. Nothing fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: leedslen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a long flight and before completing our journey.The hotel is ideal.It is clearly a transit hotel for people going on cruises and staying just one night.We had a room on the 12th floor with great views over Miami and the lagoon.The room was excellent,comfortable bed,hot shower and large bath,clean and luxurious after a long day travelling. Food and drink were reasonably priced and the service excellent.I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “some issues”
Reviews.Author: jadePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Miami for a quick weekend, and left feeling that the hotel could definitely use some improvement. First off, the parking lots (unlikely to be improved, I realize) are so tight, it took us multiple tries to park our rental PRIUS into a space! Check-in went smoothly, and we went up to our double bedroom on the 11th floor. The room was fairly standard- in decent condition overall. However, the toilet bowl was not very clean, and in fact I had to call housekeeping to clean it since it was grossing me out (and they did come). One of the double beds had a dirty pillowcase, but we slept on the other bed so we didn't make a fuss (though it did leave an impression). The Coral Cafe's breakfast and lunch were totally overpriced, but I suppose that's the price for convenience. The pool looked nice, and sitting outside by the lagoon, even with the planes flying overhead, was quite relaxing. One odd thing was that the room key cards deactivated very easily (for several of us in our large party), and we were told by the front desk not to store them near our cell phones or any credit cards....I see. Some good things- they were responsive to requests, and they were easy going about letting our large party congregate in the hotel lounge near the bar in the evenings (and without any pressure to buy drinks). In summary, it's convenient bc it's near the airport, but it could have used better housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Hotels are Spendy”
Reviews.Author: boisebrady
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the night before we left on a cruise. I spent a while on the internet deciding which hotel to stay at. On Expedia.com this hotel is 4 stars, and if you book at least 2 weeks in advance you get a few dollars off which makes the price comparable to other 3 star hotels. The shuttle to the Hotel from the airport is great. We needed it after midnight and it comes every 15 minutes. We were also looking for a shuttle to the Port of Miami. They have a shuttle that you can sign up for that goes at 11 am, 12 and 1 pm it costs $12/person. There are taxis right out in front of the Hotel, and in the morning we decided to take a taxi at our leisure it was $25. $1 is well worth not having to wait around, cram into a bus and go to each ship's port. The grounds of the hotel are pretty, the lobby is big and nice, but dated and my wife was happy there was a small gym there. The rooms are very unspectacular - comparable to any 2 1/2 or 3 star hotel. The decor was dated and the wallpaper was peeling a bit, but the bed was comfortable. I would have liked a continental breakfast, but all they offer is an expensive restaurant/buffet for breakfast. This hotel was suitable for what we were looking for, but I think we will try somewhere new next time.

Reviews.Title: “handy and comfortable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebAndKev
Reviews.Content: On our way to Turks & Caicos we had an overnight in Miami. I found a great deal at this Hilton. They had an airport shuttle and checkin was easy. In fact, when we enquired about balconies they gave us a complementary upgrade to a suite. Wow. It was spacious. We had a full living area with sofa, flat screen and desk. The bedroom had another tv. There was a sitting room outside the bathroom, which is the one thing that was odd. It was wheelchair accessible with a drain in the middle of the floor and a curtain by the shower stall with a pull down seat. It was clean but stark and sterile, a bit litke a public washroom. It was fine, but a bit strange for a suite like this. We had a big balcony overlooking the pool and lagoon. The grounds are very nice and secluded with it;s little walk to the gazebo (which we checked out early in the morning) The trade off for being so close to the airport is that you can hear the planes a little, but really with the windows closed and a/c on it was a dull noise and didn't keep me awake. We can't justify big bucks for an overnight hotel, so to stay in a suite like this for $125 for the night was pretty awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton standards...have cancelled my future reservations”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrank
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond VIP in the Hilton Honors program which means I am in a Hilton property several times a month. I have been to many Hiltons and this one is clearly not up to Hilton standards. No room upgrade (this is almost a guarantee at my usage level) or an explanation. No room upgrade to the executive level meant we were on the same floor with a loud high school group. Very limited services at their executive lounge. Delayed shuttle service. On-going problems with the automated gates (entering and exiting the gated property). Dated property in severe need of update/renovation. Service was not consisten and ranged from very poor to acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and shop-worn”
Reviews.Author: robert_dfw
Reviews.Content: It's not up to what I would consider Hilton standards. While the staff is great - friendly, helpful, and courteous, the rooms are dreadful. The television in my room was from another era and the bathroom reminded me of the early 80s. There was no in-room safe and the door & locks seemed flimsy. On the plus side, the bed was extremely comfortable and I did sleep well despite the proximity to the airport. I've stayed in hotels far worse but next time I'll stay at the Sofitel down the street.

Reviews.Title: “A Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevjet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton before our cruise to the western Carribean. After a lot of research and realizing that hotels in Miami are quite pricey, we chose a double queen room at the Hilton for a reasonable $125 a night. After reading some reviews I was not expecting a lot but it was close to the airport and our plane arrived late at night. After arriving at the airport at 11:00pm we exited to the upper level roadway and waited no more than 5 minutes for the shuttle to arrive. In a quick and comfortable 10 minute ride we arrived at the hotel. The driver called for another shuttle for some people that could not fit on the bus. Location. The hotel is on the end of a peninsula surrounded by a quiet lagoon. The water separates the hotel from the runway/freeway and the planes takeoff and land often, so if you want a really quiet spot this isn't it. However it really isn't that loud for a airport hotel and the grounds are lush and well maintained and do a lot to absorb any noise. The surroundings were safe with the hotel being in a quiet office/hotel area. Check-in was quick and effecient after an initial wait as the lone front desk person dealt with a group that had gotten dropped off at the wrong Hilton.(they were supposed to be in Ft Lauderdale....) We received a 14th floor room as requested at booking and were on our way in minutes. The room was spacious with a view out the front of the hotel to the lagoon.The windows also overlooked the end of the runway but the room was well insulated. I was prepared for the room to be a throw back from the eighties and I wasn't let down. The TV and furniture were very dated and I was surprised Hilton hadn't updated the room to their normal standard. However,everything was very clean and well kept, but the hotel in general seemed like it dropped "brand new" from the 80's into 2009. Oh well, the beds were very comfy and the bath amenities and towels were great. The Lobby, halls, elevators and downstairs were well kept but dated. We didn't eat at the buffet but it looked all right. The property, as said before, was well kept with a nice pool, outdoor bar and lots of loungers. There's a nice walkway to a gazebo with a resident iguana who didin't seem to care about posing pictures. Transportation to the cruise terminal is $25 by taxi or a shuttle is $12/person booked through the bellman. Overall a great airport hotel for a few nights but by no means luxury or a 4 star. I would have been upset if I'd paid a lot more than I had but I was very satisfied with the stay. Hilton would be wise to update this property and they would have a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for just 1 night”
Reviews.Author: JanetinVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just 1 night on a lay over. The hotel was clean, but a bit outdated. The carpet in the room on one side was wet...why would they use this room if they just cleaned it? Makes me wonder what that was...? Gross. The food however was very good. I ordered a late dinner to my room and it was very good, tasty and hot. The breakfast the next morning was also very good. The server was very polite and efficient. It is some distance from the airport however, a 10 min cab ride - perhaps stay somewhere closer with carpet that is dry? haha

Reviews.Title: “Could of been better”
Reviews.Author: jcortez13
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is the beds are comfortable. Everything else is sub par Hilton. Upon check in I was notified that I would have to pay to park, but I was not to pay the $10 mentioned here it is now $15. The parking is ridiculous, the spots are so tiny a SmartCar would have issues. I drive a compact car and every time I parked I had to squeeze out. And I'm only 5'7" 165lbs Now on to the room. They said no kings available so two queen beds it was. I have a queen bed at home and there's no way that these are that big. They look like fulls to me. I was on the 3rd floor with no view what-so-ever. I was here for a week and every day I asked to move but was told they were booked solid. But yet I could book a room via their website. Somebody's lying. My desk light would work, the bulb was hanging down from the socket. Every time I turned on the tub brown stuff (rust?) would come out for the first few seconds then the tub would fill up while taking a shower. I wish I could of stayed somewhere else, but this is where my company put me. There are a ton of other hotels on this same little strip of road. As for the food, I never ate here as there are a ton of local restaurants close by with better prices and I'm sure better food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hilton Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Miami for some personal business and as a Hilton HHonors Gold member booked this hotel as it showed the best oneline rate for its category. I did not check Trip Advisor before doing so (unusual) but our experience was very different from the reviews I read. Check in was quick through the HHonors line, and we were upgraded to a suite. Service was great throughout the 3 day stay. The room was in good condition ... standard Hilton Airport Hotel. Breakfast was good; in fact a friend staying at another hotel joined us every day as it was much better than at their hotel. The only thing I can say was not good was the condition of the corridors to the rooms, but there was a sign saying that they were working on them to upgrade plumbing. Overall, exactly what I expected from Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hilton Standards, Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: FastCarRental
Reviews.Content: It was definitely work the $105 rate on hilton.com, but the service and quality was NOT HILTON STANDARD at all. 1. Waited 20+ minutes for shuttle at the airport 2. HHonors check-in was not friendly, did not upgrade or give breakfast or lounge access and I am a Diamond member. 3. Breakfast too my omelette when I wasn't looking. 4. Old facility that needs love. 5. Sauna is out of date and needs attention. It was worth the price, but I'm glad I didn't pay much.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointed in this Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JMRN
Reviews.Content: We had a gift certificate to the Hilton Miami Airport, and were excited about combining some time in Key West with a couple of days in Miami. I have to say that our stay at the Fairfield Inn in Key West was much more satisfactory than our stay at the supposedly more upscale Hilton. I'm not sure if it is because we had a gift certificate or just the luck of the draw. We had a junior suite, on the executive floor, which was a nice perk (executive lounge provides complimentary snacks, beverages, and internet access) . However, just outside our room was the intake for the heating/cooling system and there was a constant loud hum that was clearly audible from inside the room. In addition to that, the elevator shaft was directly behind the headboard to our bed. With EACH time the elevator went up or down, everywhere in our building, we could hear the WHOOSH , followed by the squeak of the cables. I lay awake counting, and estimated it at every 20-30 seconds; no kidding. Besides that, the vents for the air conditioner are positioned pointing directly at the head of the bed. There is no way to re-direct the vent or escape the air (unless, I guess, you slept with your head at the foot of the bed... but that brings its own problems!) We discovered all this late at night as we were getting ready to go to bed. We also discovered a pillow covered in someone else's makeup and that we had no washrags. Again, it was late and we were tired. I just left a note for the housekeeper the next AM to please change the pillowcase and leave washrags, which she did. Unfortunately, she didn't leave more coffee, so we had to call for that the next morning. The room itself seemed clean enough (with the exception of the one pillowcase). I have seen a mention in another review of being able to hear your neighbors' noise, and I'll have to say that I did hear their phone quite clearly ringing. Other than that, they must have been pretty quiet people. Even with its proximity to the airport, I didn't hear airplane noise. We had the breakfast buffet each morning. The selections were quite good, and there is a cooked-to order omelet/egg station which offers pancakes or waffles as well. As in other Hiltons, expect to pay $22 for breakfast. We were made to feel at checkout as though putting up with the noise was all our fault; and I suppose if we'd felt like packing up everything at 11PM and moving, we could have moved to a quieter room. I would suggest instead that the hotel see what it could do to mitigate the noise issues in that room! The hotel itself is very nice overall and I'm sure that not all the rooms have the noise issues we faced. Parking is $15/day for self parking and seemed to be plentiful and easy to get in and out with your room key. My advice: If you check in, before you unpack, do a careful "sound check" before you decide to keep your room!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: stace120
Reviews.Content: First off I love Hiltons and I travel a lot so I try to be really fair in reviews. Secondly I think that there are probably a lot of different room types at this hotel so that may explain the difference in reviews. This is a very, very busy airport hotel so expect the general qualities found in such- long lines/ waits and sometimes crowds. I arrived late so I had no problem checking in. The front desk staff was very efficient and courteous. I booked a balcony room which meant i could only get 2 double beds. The balcony wsn't really much. There was a tiny door to go out to a three foot wide balcony with a high cement wall and lots of mildew. This was clearly meant for smokers and not for people who wanted to enjoy a balcony. The room itself was pretty dated and not especially clean. I had ordered a bottle of wine online which was not in the room when I arrived. I recieved a phone call from room service at MIDNIGHT wanting to deliver the wine. They argued when I said it was too late, but ultimately did not bring the wine and did not charge me. The business center was very nice. They had everything I needed. It was very spacious and well equipped. Check out went okay, but I did wait a very long time for somecody fromHertz to show up at the bell desk to rent me a car- which I had reserved. All in all, this was a decent experience, but I would try to get an updated room and would not order room service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for transfer”
Reviews.Author: KateP_Europe
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels near the airport. The price appropriate to the overall experience. The hotel is situated in the nice surrounding (near the airport, but in a silent neighborhood). Good place to stay few days and sightseeing in Miami. If someone wants to spend most of time on the beach we rather recommend hotel in Miami Beach. Hilton has a good service, however disadvantage is that there is no safe deposit in the room (there is only one at the reception desk).

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel with cunningly hidden light switches”
Reviews.Author: Kandelh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in an Executive Floor room on a one night stopover between London and Cancun. The room was alright and the only problem we had was trying to turn the lights on which turned into a bit of a joke. But we got there in the end. The room had great views of the lagoon. We ate in the bar and the food was slightly expensive for the quality, but was all edible and the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was included as part of our room and was standard buffet style. No major complaints there and again the staff were nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here, Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: RSMikeIreland
Reviews.Content: Difficult to figure out the variable ratings for this hotel based on our excellent experince. We were originally booked to stay the last three nights of our holiday at a nearby ( not Homewood) suites hotel, however after a very disappointing stay at that hotel a week earlier (despite its excellent tripadvisor rating), it was with some trepidation that we switched to the Hilton (it was the only hotel I could find in a hurry with availability). I had read some of the poor reviews here but figured it could not get much worse than our experience at the the nearby suites hotel. Maybe I was lucky because I got the Hilton Honors floor (Floor 11 as far as I can remember?), but our room was very comfortable, clean and functioning, no smells or mustiness. We did opt to pay $20 a night extra for a balcony room ( can be selected by booking on hilton.com), The balcony is a bit small with no furniture but excellent for smokers ( my wife is one unfortunately!). We had a very pleasnat view over the lagoon on one side and Miami Airport on the other ( great fun if you enjoy an occasional bit of plane spotting, :-) ), and when the doors windows are closed , minimal noise from the airport ( the airport stops at night anyway, so no real worries about noise). My advice would be to go for the balcony rooms, based on the hotel layout, I figure they are all corner rooms so possibly a bit larger and with more windows. Even after paying $20 extra a night at the hilton over the other suites hotel the rate was still $30 a night cheaper, and the hilton is a full service hotel, Just beware you will get stung with $10 a night for parking ("swings and roundabouts") at the Hilton About the hotel staff, and reports of rudeness on earlier reviews, We made a few front desk queries and used the reataurant one morning for breakfast, everyone was very pleasnt and helpful, The security guys at the hotel entrance were also very friendly. If I was in the vicinity I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old & Smelly”
Reviews.Author: winniepoo
Reviews.Content: While this hotel was close to the airport, which was our number one priority, we would have rather stayed anywhere, even further away, that had a fresh and new atmosphere. A major renovation is needed. And we wanted a king, but got two twins. The manager blew us off and made no attempt to accomodate us. Thumbs down!

Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip in Miami”
Reviews.Author: wesandkim
Reviews.Content: We transferred from another Hilton hotel to this one at 11pm at night. They saved our trip in Miami. The room was clean, no weird smells in the room, bathroom was clean and they had HOT water which was a big deal that night. Check in and out was fast and courteous, the rate was exceptionally reasonable. The night staff was friendly and was even smiling, cannot say that for the last hotel we check out of. The shuttle was prompt at 5am and again very nice. Great stay. Would book again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Oswego90
Reviews.Content: I had to write this review because our recent experience at the Hilton Miami Airport was so different from the previous reviewer's. We (mother 50's and daughter 23 yrs) booked the hotel for 2 nts. pre-cruise in mid-August. I was able to get a great rate for an Executive Floor room w/ 2 double beds. Maybe this made all the difference. The room was beautiful. The beds were wonderful. The food in the Executive Club was great - and since we stayed during the Olympics, many people were popping in and out of the Club to watch Michael Phelps. Very pleasant, relaxing experience. The weekend staff, too, was wonderful. Check-in was a breeze at the HHonors dedicated desk. The bellmen and concierge staff were friendly and helpful. I had a fun conversation with the shuttle driver as I rode from the hotel over to the airport on Sat. night to meet my daughter's flight. Returning on the shuttle, however, was more problematic. Two or three shuttle vans passed us by because they had filled beyond capacity at the International terminal and had no room for the domestic passengers waiting. Eventually, the hotel sent a shuttle just for us and for the other family who had been waiting with us for quite some time. Sunday, we decided to go to the pool early to catch some sun before the imminent arrival of Tropical Storm Fay. Again, loved the pool...AND the very large(!) iguana who twice visited the pool deck during our stay and seemed quite at home. As others have mentioned, the lagoon surroundings are beautiful and are filled with wildlife - lizards, birds, etc. Negatives: the fact that WiFi access is not free and that food in the restaurant and pool bar is on the expensive side (the drinks at the pool bar were pricey and small). Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are able to book a deluxe or Executive Floor room. (One more note: we had no trouble at all with airport noise - our room faced east, and the view at night was spectacular.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Black
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks a bit dated and could use some freshening up but, overall, we had a very positive experience staying there. We stayed there the night before our Caribbean cruise vacation and the hotel was located just a short drive far from the Miami Cruise Port. As far as safety, we had absolutely no problem there-- the place looked quite safe. The beds were clean and comfortable. The restaurant food was decent, although pricey. The buffet breakfast cost us almost $70 (for two adults and two kids) but it was delicious and offered a lot of variety. There are a lot of parking spaces at the hotel but self-parking will cost you $10 per day + tax. For us, that was the biggest negative. We paid about $145 for the room for the one-night stay and overall it was a very good choice. If we're in the Miami area in the future, we would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Miami Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 413KIMBERLY
Reviews.Content: A group of 11 of us stayed at the Hilton Miami Hotel for 2 nights. One night prior and one night after a trip to Caribbean. We all enjoyed our stay. We found the rooms to be clean and attractive and the beds to be comfortable. The pool area was nice and we all had a great time using the large outdoor swimming pool. The grounds were beautiful and the kids had a great time looking at the wildlife surrounding the water. We got some fun pictures of Iguanas and lizards and never felt that we were staying at the airport. Down side, room service and restaurants were very expensive. Spent $15.00 at breakfast cart for three little cups of orange juice!

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: cmego
Reviews.Content: We checked in for one night only. We were on the executive floor, and to our surprise we thought we walked back in time. The room looked like it was from the 70's. The decor, tv, bathroom. We were shocked. Not what we expected. The executive lounge was nice. Many items to choose from and nice view and updated. The pool seemed small considering the size of the so called resort. Small bar by the pool with middle aged group having a good time. There was a small band playing. We ate at the cafe. That was nice, quick and price was good too. Overall, nice on the outside and entrance, old inside and OVERRATED. For the price we paid, I would not stay here again until there is a remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Gaet stay, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: konnihall
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights and we had a lovely time. The room was very large but a bit worn down. The service was excellent, specially the concierge guys. They totally did everything to help us out with our day trips etc. Our son got some skin rashes during our stay and instead of sending us off with a taxi to the pharmacy, one of the bell boy drove us there and offered to wait for us to drive us back. Room service and the loundry staff wen't out their way to find a teddybear our son lost but they didn't find it until we were at the airport so Maria ( laundry service ) took the airport shuttle to deliver it to us, that's good service. I would give it 5 stars if the room had been a little more fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: pattieTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 night stopover at this hotel before flying on to our next destination next evening. We booked a deluxe room and were surprised by it's size. Very large with a separate bedroom, seemed more like a junior suite. Bed was very comfortable. Excellent breakfast. Good all round service. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine by us”
Reviews.Author: Chunky-M0nkey
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here as a stop over having flown in to Miami. We arrived at the hotel, checked in very quickly and went to our room. It was very comfortable, all the usual ammenities you get from a Hilton. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom clean, air conditioning was quiet. The Executive lounge is OK, it was fine for a quick beer, the sports bar in the lobby had more atmosphere. The view of the sunrise on the balcony ofthe room was great. Breakfast in the lounge was a waste of time, to many people for the size of lounge, but i guess we happened to be there at a very busy time. Taking the hilton shuttle back to the airport and then catching the rental car shuttle to pick the car up was a good idea, you can then pop back to the hotel and pick you bags up, save a lot of hassle, you wont get charged for parking if your there less than two hours. We have stayed before and we will stay again, as i said its fine by us

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - smells and poor service”
Reviews.Author: aadalal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a couple of days in March. We had made the reservations through Hotwire which claimed that it was a 40-star hotel at a 2-star price. However, when we got to the hotel, it soon became apparent that it was no where close to a 4-star. The rooms were smelly. Also, room service was terrible - we were not ready for them when they came and told them to come again. But they assumed that we didn't want service at all. Overall, the hotel is not reasonably priced and the location is not convenient - unless you want to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, It's Decent”
Reviews.Author: Good_Apples
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a team business trip for 2 weeks. I'm "eh" about this hotel. In general, most of the staff were very nice, but the hotel itself is just ok. Maybe I was expecting a higher caliber of hotel considering my company uses this place all the time. There were times when you'd call for room service and the line would be busy...then you'd call the front desk line and that was busy too! I ended up having to call the hotel front desk from my cell phone several times to get something I needed. Once I got someone, they were nice about it. The hotel itself is kind of grungy. The hallways are 80's style (much like Golden Girls like someone else said) and my room was ok. It served it's purpose. The internet service worked intermittedly, and the bathroom had a little bit of grime/mold growing in the shower grout. Oh, and someone else's hair was still stuck to the shower wall when I went to take my first shower. Most people don't notice those kinds of things, but I do. They do charge for everything...hotel tax, convention tax, occupancy tax, air tax (kidding!), parking, etc. So just check your bill to make sure everything is correct. Unfortunately, I will probably have to stay here again. Given the customer service, it totally makes up for the older property. Again, it's not a terrible hotel, just "eh" for what the company pays for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this very convenient airport hotel for one night after a week in the Caribbean. We found it very good, friendly staff with extensive facilities for an airport hotel. Airport shuttle very efficient and regular. We were upgraded to a suite as Hilton Diamond members, it was a really lovely room. Curved in shape with living area and quite spacious(although bathroom was small). Yes there was some noise from the planes as pointed out from another review, but you expect this from an airport hotel and it wasn't really too troublesome.The executive floor was well stocked and staff all very helpful. We ate in the restaurant for dinner and thought the buffet was good value and pretty good quality food. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kadita
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice before a cruise and this past time was good. We arrived late in Miami and had to wait about 45 minutes to check in to the hotel. The hotel itself is ok. It is clean but does appear to be run down in some areas. It is safe and secure as compared to some other places we stayed at in Miami. The planes are loud but you do get used to it. Everyone was helpful and the porters were great in getting us on our way to the port although they did not let us know that there was a convoy on the way and that we could have shared expenses. The scenery was beautiful and the ground were nice and well kept. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hilton in the flight path of the Miami airport”
Reviews.Author: M_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the airport Hilton in Miami for one night this past week on business. It was a nice, pleasant, clean Hilton at a pretty good price and I would likely stay there again although I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there again. The good: The room was standard Hilton fare. Clean, well kept and up to my expectations for a Hilton. Check-in was quick and easy, and overall the hotel was very nice. The not-so-good: I stayed on the side of the hotel that faced that water and being so close to the airport this side of the hotel overlooks (and overhears) the flight path. I always bring ear plugs when I travel so I didn't allow it to disturb my slumber, but it could have/would have had I not planned ahead.

Reviews.Title: “First-rate Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunchaser56
Reviews.Content: Having left our cruise liner at 730 am we were whisked off to the Miami Hilton at the airport which was just 15 minutes away. Reception was polite and efficient and as the room wasn't ready we enjoyed an excellent buffet breakfast, this served to us by a charming Italian waiter. We lay by the pool for a couple of hours which was spacious and clean and offered fresh towels poolside. Nice gym and hot-tub at poolside too if you wished. Rooms were ready by 1030 and they were excellent. Took the coutesy bus to the Dolphin Mall and shopped for a few hours.....take (or in our case buy) an extra suitcase as the exchange rate really does mean you can pick up some massive savings. This hotel is a five minute ride from the terminal and I shall definitely use it again when in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Brrrrr.....”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the airport but overdue for renovation - reminded me of the decor on the Golden Girls. I've stayed there twice, about 6 mths apart and had to move business meetings outdoors both times because we were freezing. Seriously, if you stay here, take a jacket. The gym is tiny - the pool is quite large though and nice in the evening. Plane noise is frequent and irritating if you are by the pool, but not apparent in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: cws21
Reviews.Content: We requested and received alcove rooms and LOVED this hotel. The rooms were completely renovated and modern with Flat screen TVs and contemporary furnishings. The shuttle to the airport was convenient. The evening buffet was wonderful for $19 apiece. The beds and bedding were fabuous. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: dianemom2
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel through on on-line booking site. We did not expect much based on the price we paid. We were thrilled when we arrived and saw how nice the Hilton was. It was so close to the airport that if did not need our rental car for other reasons, I would never have gotten a car. The hotel is right across the street from the airport. The doorman and luggage service were extremely nice and very efficient. At check-in the clerk was very friendly and was able to switch our room to one that was further from the elevators. My kids swam in the beautiful, heated outdoor pool and had a great t ime. There was also table tennis which they loved. They were working on the hot tub so we were not able to use it but they finished working on it just as we were leaving the pool area. Our room was spacious and very clean and nicely decorated. Beds were very comfortable although queen sized beds instead of double would have been nicer. The concierge was knowledgeable and made several good recommendations, including one fantastic restaurant for dinner. We ate breakfast in one of the hotel restaurants. It was a very good breakfast but it was a bit slow. All in all, it was a lovely hotel and I would definitely stay there again. PS Don't miss the four huge parrots in cages right near the front door. A couple of them talk and my kids were thrilled!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ttbnf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton with some friends the night before we went on a cruise. The best thing about the hotel was the area behind the building - it was beautiful. There was a pool and bar, tables and chairs set up to look across the water and just enjoy the scenery. Other than that, it was just an ordinary hotel. Thankfully, it was clean and tidy. It is within walking distance to a few fast food restaurants, a grocery and liquor store. The next morning, our room was cleaned before checkout time, before we had checked out or removed our stuff from the room. And the cleaning lady got upset with me when I sat on the bed because it had already been made - she actually told me to get off it and not mess up the room. Apparently because everyone leaves at the same time (because of the checkout time) rule they have to clean before people leave. Every hotel has a checkout time - but I have never had a problem or been treated so rudely before. Overall, I've stayed in nicer, been treated better and didn't think this was worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BNL-Loroo
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, noisy, smelly, dirty mess. We were too tired to think of changing hotels and picked a small suite (separate living and sleeping areas) to relax and regroup after a cruise. Didn't happen. Food options were expensive and not to our liking. I ordered a salad with the dressing on the side. Arrived with dressing literally on the side of the bowl with the lettuce. Huh?!? Needed an early flight out and there were NO breakfast options available (even a bowl of cereal). Staff seemed moderately helpful but I expected much more. I was absolutely spoiled at the Downtown Seattle Hilton but I would never stay at this one again. We also stayed at the Airport Marriott and definitely prefer it (and it was cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, but too noisy and the place needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: coolcaesar
Reviews.Content: The first room they gave me smelled like a smoker's room even though I made it clear at the front desk that I needed a non-smoker's room. Fortunately, the second room smelled fine. The bed was pleasant and comfortable; the bathroom was immaculate and well-maintained; the furnishings and room overall were clean and in good shape. I went out to the fitness center, which is located in its own pleasant little building next to the pool and is open 24 hours. The fitness center is well equipped with a set of free weights, and multiple late-model treadmills and stairmasters, each with its own small flat-screen TV and headphones so everyone can watch what they want without bothering anyone else. The pool area, fitness center, and lobby all look fine. The major downside of this hotel, as numerous other reviewers have noted, is the proximity to the airport. Even though the place is clearly heavily soundproofed, you can clearly hear a distant roar every ten minutes (and sometimes the building shakes). I am a very deep sleeper so I don't mind, but any light sleepers would be well advised to avoid this place. The second big downside is the expensive parking. Because there is no street parking on Blue Lagoon Drive, and all the other parking lots nearby are secured private lots for various corporate office buildings, you have no choice but to pay $10 per day to park in the Hilton's lot. At least they let registered guests go in and out so it's not like you're trapped. As several people have noted, there are no major restaurants nearby (Burger King headquarters is down the street but there's no Burger King to go with it) so you will have to drive a distance if you want something other than room service or the hotel restaurant. Finally, although well-maintained, the hotel is beginning to look dated and in need of a renovation. This is especially obvious in the elevator lobbies and elevators; the control panels both in the lobbies and the elevators are clearly quite battered and need to be replaced. The elevators are also noisy and cranky. I was pleased overall considering that I got a good deal on Hotwire during a weekend when much of Miami was fully booked and the remaining hotels were charging insanely exorbitant rates. But I would not stay at this hotel if I were booking through a regular service like Expedia or Orbitz.

Reviews.Title: “The old bait & switch”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in serious need of a facelift. Or I should say, the rooms are in need of a face lift. When you walk into the lobby area it's very pretty and inviting. However, when you get to your room, it's a different story. Hence this review title of "bait & switch". The beds are comfortable enough and the rooms are plenty large. However, the bathroom is gross and in serious need of updating. I actually saw two rooms during my stay since I asked to switch my first room and the bathrooms look edexactly the same; dingy, dirty, and badly in need of updating. The small square tiles in the shower were in need of more grout and alot of caulking was missing around the tub. The bathroom reminded you of a Motel 6. I would stay elsewhere if you can. However, if you book of priceline or hotwire the way I did, good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “not a great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: jjservices
Reviews.Content: Spent a night in a one bedroom suite here...suite is big with nice size living room and big bedroom..bathoom is tiny and very dirty..the whole room gave me the impression of being dirty..do not think the drapes were ever cleaned... had room service..asked for pasta with tomato sauce for our baby and said not garlic of course the sauce was full of garlic...not a great experience with them. Bed is very comfy..but the room is noisy..and you can hear all the planes take off. Baggage service is slow..took 20 minutes from our room to the lobby...very dissaponting stay

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: bdh1968
Reviews.Content: The property is dated and really nothing special. Hilton charges "extra" every time you sneeze: small bottled water $3.25, internet $12, parking $20, etc. The surrounding area is a business park adjacent to Miami International Airport and a sketchy neighborhood. There are virtually no restaurants around, except at the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ... but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: If you are a light sleeper, this place (and probably the other hotels in the area) is not for you. Some airport hotels are not directly in the path â€¦ not this place. Well past midnight and early in the morning the planes can be heard â€¦ and loud. The Hotel This is a nice place. The lobby is well-done, the bar and restaurants look nice, there is a decent pool complex in the rear that overlooks a lagoon and the place is well maintained. The hallways to the rooms are in good shape and the hotel does not show much age. The service was very good. The rooms About average for a Hilton. As with most full-service Hiltons, the beds are extremely comfortable. The room was clean and laid out nice. Also not sowing much age. Air conditioning works well. TV is not HD. Bathroom is not that big but efficient. Did not use any the facilities or the restaurant. Went to the Executive Lounge (for HH members) to eat breakfast and was well stocked for breakfast. Self parking was $7 Overall, a very good hotel â€¦ just beware of the noise factor. If that is a problem, stay closer to downtown, Miami Beach or in Coral Gables

Reviews.Title: “One night only”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton - Miami Airport in September 2007 for 5 nights, with my wife, as part of our vacations. We stayed in Miami for shopping basically. Ih I had the chance, I would not do that again. We paid our stay through HHonors points, as my wife is a Silver VIP guest. Even though, the hotel gave us a 2 double beds room, in spite of our express request of a king room. In my evaluation, that probably happened because we were paying with points. In spite of that, the major issue of the hotel is the noise due to the airport. The bedroom was really big and clean. I couldn't get the curtains to blackout completely, and the sun waked us up daily. Air conditioning was also somehow noisy (seemed quite old). Bathroom was ok, even it was starting to look old. I would also add that the mini-bar (a small fridge) was also noisy (probably old one). Parking is paid, and I really don't understand why. In summary, I would only stay there again if I needed to be near the airport, and for one night only. For more nights, I would be somewhere away from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mainstay Hotel for Us”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGetaways43
Reviews.Content: Have stayed a this Hilton several times. It's a great getaway for us and a good stopover for travelers. We've stayed in an Executive King/ Non-Smoking. Had a great view of the Lagoon and the Miami Skyline. The room has mini-bar, 27 inch TV, work desk area and an easy chair. This hotel has been around for a while but it remains consistently above average even though the furniture appears to be aging. The bed is Great as with all the Hilton Hotels I have stayed in. The best room we had was an Alcove Room (get an upper floor for a nice view) which is very large and also has large screen LCD TV's with wrap around sofa and easy chair - were recently updated for the previous Super Bowl when the Chicago Bears stayed here. The hotel has 14 floors with the first 11 floors having north and south wings. The top 3 floors are considered Tower Rooms and are part of the Executive and HHonors Levels. I love the Breakfast in the Executive Lounge, with Continental Breakfast fare and attentive service.I must admit though, I do not like the coffee. I think they recently changed brands and it is not very good in my opinion. Pool Bar is very good with Marco the bartender a very helpful and kind man. He was fun to talk to. The pool is great for all the family. There is a workout gym with cardio equipment and machine weights ( alas no free weights) We had the Sunday Brunch in the Coral Cafe at $25.95 per person. It is worth the price if you bring a healthy appetite. I find the regular menu a little limited in choices, but the prices are pretty good for hotel fare, as well as tasty. I did ask for variations of the main course I had requested and was quickly accommodated. Wireless internet is 9.95 per day and if service is slow, call the front desk and they will send up a device to help improve the reception ( we were in a wing room on the 11th floor) The staff here is very nice. Front desk service was quick, courteous and painless. The hotel is located not far from a Publix Super Market, CVS Pharmacy ( 24 hour) and some fast food places. Parking is $11 valet/ $7 self-park. Overall, I rate this as a Very Good Hotel with the right amenities and services to earn it a 4 star Hotel. We will return when we need a getaway, but need to remain local.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor experience”
Reviews.Author: The-Real-Zard
Reviews.Content: Hello! This has to be one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at

Reviews.Title: “Good quick stay”
Reviews.Author: Yzerwing
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in July 2007 at the Hilton after arriving on a late flight into MIA. The shuttle was very easy to pick up and I waited less than 2 minutes for it to arrive (good timing more than frequency of trips I think, but not sure- I think shuttles run about every 15 minutes). The shuttle picks you up at the departures level, so if you have checked luggage, you need to pick that up at the lower level and go upstairs to departures to catch the bus. The hotel itself was good. Check in was quick and painless. I was given a chocolate bar upon arrival, which was a nice treat. The wrapper of the chocolate bar advertised that the hotel had been recently renovated. I'm not sure that was true of the room I was in. While the linens and furniture may have been newer, the bathroom looked a little old and the tv was ancient. That being said, I had no problems with the room. I didn't notice any noise from the airplanes. The bed was comfortable and I didn't have any major issues for the short time I was there. I did not eat at any of the restaurants or have room service, so I can't offer any input on the food at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: mdixit1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hilton overnight while connecting a flight through Miami. I arrived late at night and left early morning. I didnt have any trouble checking in. The room was beautiful and I loved the decor!! I didnt use any services as such so no comments on that. Other than that, an enjoyable stay. Also, its close to the airport so it makes it convenient to travel esp when connecting flights.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been loads better”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gen
Reviews.Content: We had to come up to Miami on business near to the airport so we opted for the Hilton. However, as it turns out I should have probably gone with my first instinct and booked a Sheraton instead. The hotel itself was not bad. It was an older building and in need of some updating but still nice. Upon arriving we had the option of valet parking our vehicle or self parking it but both cost money so we valeted it for the added convenience. The valet person did not speak English but he tried to be helpful. The same was true for many of the employees here. I understand this is Miami, but it is stil lteh USA and I think that if you are in the service industry here you should speak the language! It would be different if I went to Spain and the people spoke Spanish. Anyway...check in was pretty simple and the bellman was nice. He escorted us to our room, we had reserved a king executive room, and we got settled. The room was nice. a closter, a vanity area, a bathroom with a tub, a table and chairs, and a bed that was not anywhere near being a king. Now I requested a king bed because my husband is 6'6" and has a bad back. This bed may have been a queen but I really think it was a double. His legs were hanging off the end of the bed and the mattress was very lumpy. I have a great back and am only 5'5" and I felt cramped and uncomfortable i nthis bed. So, I spoke to someone at the front desk about this and I was told that all of the "king" beds at this hotel were that size so I had no options. We thought it would be okay since it was only 3 nights but by the last night my husband was almost crippled from back pain. We wanted to go to dinner someplace on teh first night and so once again we asked a few employees directions and of course they did not speak English well enough to help us so we were on our own. Luckily we found where we were looking for after a few wrong turns. No harm done. The hotel has a decent gym that we utilized a couple of times. weight machines, ellipticles, treadmills, bikes... That was a nice feature. I also used the pool one day. It is ia decent sized pool but I think it should have been cleaner. There were tons of bugs floating around that should have been dealt with. I was not the only one that felt this way as I heard several other pool-goers voice the same opinion while I was out there. It was very hot out and I realized that I forgot my sunscreen so I asked the pool bartender if he knew where I could get some sunscreen and he sent me to the hotel gift shop next about 50 steps away. I walked in to the timy room and looked for sunscreen. The ladies working there were busy chatting with one another to bother seeing if I needed any help. After looking around for about 10 minutes I found spf 3 and it cost something like $18! What is the point?! Anyway, I finally interrupted their conversation and asked if they had anything a bit stronger and they said "no" and resumed their conversation. Luckily, I had a sample packet of bullfrog hidden in my purse that I had forgotten about so I used that. Otherwise I would have ben toasted. I ordered a drink and a salad from the pool bar during my pool excursion. The service here was less than impressive. However, I think part of this was due to the fact that they were understaffed here. There was one bartender and he had to help everyone at he pool plus he had to keep running inside to pick up the food orders so her would be gone for 10 minutes at a time leaving the bar unattended and the customers waiting. Then, when he got back he was not very attentive either. All I had was a Pepsi and I had to ask him for a refill each time even though he looked right at my glass and could clearly see that it was empty. The salad was not bad. I got room service one day. The service was quick and the food was ok, nothing impressive though. We also ate at the hotel restaurant a couple of times. service here was pretty good, especially at breakfast. I liked the fact that they had fresh squeezed OJ. I thin kthat every restaurnat in the state of Florida should have fresh Squeezed citrus juices. It is Florida for crying out loud! Our service at dinner was not as good and the restaurant wa not that packed either. It was much busier at breakfast. Check out was easy too. I was glad to leave and I will not return to the Maimi Airport Hilton, even if it were for free. All in all, it was not the worse place I stayed but I expected more from a Hilton, much more.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: Augusttravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the start of our vacation and a second night at the end of our vacation. Both visit's were very pleasant. I booked two rooms online and we wanted them to be joined since we were travelling with several kids. The front desk was very helpful in finding us rooms that were joined. The staff was very nice and courtious. We checked in before the 3 pm check in time w/out a hitch too which was nice. The rooms were clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The rooms did appear to have some wear and tear but nothing terrible. The pool area was nice and clean but the water was like a warm bath. It would have been nice if they had some cooler water pumped in but the kids seemed to enjoy the luke warm water. I did however notice that the noise from the airplanes taking off and landing were louder in some rooms then others. Our last night there I was in the "boys room" and nearly fell off the bed from the sound of a plane taking off. In the "girls room" you could barely hear it. After further inspection of the windows I found that the window in the boys room wasn't sealed tightly for some reason. It looked like a lot of the weather stripping had peeled away from the window. Its a great place to stay for an overnight trip due to convienance to the airport but I wouldn't want to spend my whole vacation there. The airport is just too close and the planes are practically taking off over your head while you lay by the pool. I think our highlight of our trip was the waiter by the name of Joseph. He served us during breakfast and was so great with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: tcufan12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and has a great location. However, we had the worst service ever in the cafe. I've never experienced worse customer service in my life. Don't be surprised if you experience the same thing if you eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, solid airport hotelâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: Had less than 12 hours total here, transiting from San Juan to back home. Arrived around 7:30p; hotel shuttle came within 10 minutes of my stepping onto the curb at the airportâ€¦ as per prior posters, do note that hotel shuttles pick up and drop off on Departures level! This means schlepping bags back upstairs from baggage claim. Check in was friendly. I had reserved a king/non-smoking, and reiterated this request at the deskâ€¦ the gentleman had no king beds, so I asked if I could at least get an airport viewâ€¦ none available, so he upgraded me to Concierge floorâ€¦ unexpected, as Iâ€™ve just fallen back to Blue level at Hilton. My room, with two double beds, was nicely appointed, and certainly clean. Bed linens were sharp looking and quite comfy, sufficient and high quality pillows. Wifi signal was strong. Bathroom stuff was Crabtree & Evelyn. I visited the Concierge lounge around 8:30p, and the hostess was just starting to break down the hors dâ€™ouervesâ€¦ but she stopped when I came in. I had a really nice appetizer here of coconut fried shrimp and a glass of reasonable, but not great, white wine. I went back to the lobby to get a postcard to send to Kiddo, and was stunned at the absolute scrum in the lobby. HUNDREDS of people, all in formal wearâ€¦ turns out they were hosting both a high school prom AND a very large wedding reception. I ducked into the deserted The Cove restaurant, where I had a tasty appetizer. Service was crisp and friendly. I was up at 5:30a, and, although they didnâ€™t open until 6-something, the hostess at concierge lounge connected me with coffee around 5:50aâ€¦ nice, because she certainly had the option of sending me away until they opened. I went back around 7a and the breakfast spread looked pretty good. They have a pc/printer in the lounge where boarding passes can be printed. Checked out and was on the 7:30a shuttle bus, and away. Solid hotelâ€¦ I counted 18 consecutive AAA 4-Diamond awards on the wall in the lobby, so theyâ€™re obviously doing things consistently well. I was pleased with the overnight, and would be happy to return if I needed to transit MIA. Employees uniformly helpful and crisp, and the public spaces looked pretty sharp. Good bed, clean room. Not sure how convenient this would be as a Miami business destination, but as airport hotels go, this was really good. If you were doing a night pre- or post-cruise, would be very good.

Reviews.Title: “Too few elevators”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter900
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Miami Airport lacks sufficient elevators and wait times can be a bit long. A hotel of this size needs at least twice the number of elevators. Otherwise, service was perfect, reliable, dependable Hilton quality.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: jatravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a business trip for three nights. The room was just average (the walls were a bit dingy and the carpeting had some stains and needed to be better vaccuumed). Looked like it needed a general update. The bathroom was pretty out of date and the tub surround could have been a little cleaner. The hotel staff was nice and the restaurant was superb. I ate about five meals at the hotel both through room service and in the restaurant. Although pricey, it was high quality. The location was central (10 minutes from the airport, 15 from U of Miami, 45 from Ft. Lauderdale). A collegue had a suite which was very nice and appeared to be newly remodeled with several rooms. The best part about my room was definitely the beds. Extremely comfortable. Rooms go quickly in Miami in the spring, so reserve early to get a low rate. With 1.5 weeks notice we paid on average around $200 plus tax directly through the hotel. Weekend rates were cheaper by about $70. There was also a free shuttle to the airport that runs every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: lttravel92
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton 1 day prior to a cruise. We used the shuttle from the airport were we only waited 2-3 minutes for a shuttle. Arrived early enough to enjoy the enormous, heated pool all to ourselves. Rooms were very clean, asked for adjoining rooms and everything was as requested. Beds were very comfortable, room was very clean. Front desk check-in was quick, friendly and helpful. Did use the exercise room and while it was small it was functional. Would recommend the hotel prior to a cruise, cabs were easy to obtain outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: kiddogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before a business meeting in Miami. Close to the airport, odd that you have to wait at arrivals for the shuttle to the hotel. Quck trip about 5 minutes. Hotel is large and more for business meetings. Executive lounge is small but functional. Rooms are spacious and I had a nice view of Miami. Food at the bar was very lame, did not try the restaurants. Cabs stay at the hotel so transportation is easy. Gym was small and you have to walk outside to get their...not cool in the rain. Pool area is large.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable stopover”
Reviews.Author: 5WW
Reviews.Content: Flying in late from London, we just wanted to get to a bed as quickly and painlessly as possible. The hotel runs a frequent shuttle service and the journey is short. The reception was efficient an we were in our generously sized room quickly. After a quick swim and bite to eat, we slept like babies. Yes you can hear the planes, I'm not sure we would have heard a squadron of fighter jets though. Morning check out was efficient, the bill very reasonable- we flew on to Mexico, ready to really get into our holiday. Good job Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: jp7541
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle from Airport to Hotel is a nice touch, although there is some confusion as to whether it runs 24hrs or stops after 0200. They need to make this more clear. Check in late at night can take a while - only a handful of staff around on the check in desk, so when the shuttle drops off it passengers it can take a while to check in. However once checked in there were no problems. Room was fine. Clean, light and well equipped. The sound proofing from the rooms is ok, but you can still hear the planes sometimes. The facilities are good too. Unfortunately we weren't there long enough to use the pool, but looked very nice. Location-wise, i found it wasnt close to anything, apart from the airport, so wouldnt recommend staying here if you've come to see the sights of miami, unless you are willing to pay for taxis. Overall, its a good hotel, but one used for business or the layover at miami rather than one used for vactioning in miami

Reviews.Title: “think twice”
Reviews.Author: kymz67vn
Reviews.Content: . We had two days prior to our cruise departure so we decided to stay here because of the proximity to the airport and port. Our stay was 2/9-2/11. From the moment we arrived I knew that this was not worth the 200 per night. The front desk assistance was rude. No one offered any assistance with our bags until we asked for assistance. The room for the price offered was just basic. However, the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I dont think anyone had command of the english language (if they did they pretended like they didnt). At check out we still receivied the same rude service as when checkng in. I had the impression that I was doing everyone a favor by staying there and I was a minor inonvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: jimpeterson
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here and I was very pleased. I saw a previous review that said the service was bad. I carry my own bags and would rather the staff didn't look at me much less smile at me. I love that the room service is 24x7. Whenever I am in another city and need this service, it isn't available. The bed was an excellent premium Hilton bed. Top of the line. The restaurant was great for dinner, breakfast, and a snack via room service. They didn't seem to mind that we used a table for a meeting later in the day and only ordered a few drinks. (We left a big tip) Everything was clean. Standard TV. Not too small, not flat panel HDTV.

Reviews.Title: “Someone please smile”
Reviews.Author: Jana06
Reviews.Content: I booked a Saturday night stay here using my Hilton honors rewards prior to embarking on a cruise. As a frequent business and leisure traveler, I noticed several issues which set this property apart from others in a negative way mostly related to the service and staff. I was not offered assistance with my bags when entering the hotel, despite trying to juggle 3 bags. I was not greeted in a friendly manner, but rather an expressionless reception with just the basic information communicated. The room was average and clean. I did have access to the Executive lounge which was OK and had both hot and cold finger foods available for happy hour (note: they charge $3.50 for wine/beer/cocktails, other beverages are free). The pool area was OK, but filled with bored looking folks just wishing to be somewhere else. The pool bartender oscillated somewhere between curt and proactively rude. The concierge was clueless when it came to asking about the best way to the cruise terminal. I had to flag down someone to hold my bags past check-out and then the process of getting the bags to a cab was an exercise in patience for the incompetence and rudeness demonstrated by the bell hops. The service was simply unacceptable and lousy, not a single friendly gesture among the staff apart from the young woman staffing the Executive lounge who was not necessarily friendly rather just unoffensive.
