I would not recommend this hotel for anyone unless it's the only one in town and you need to be by the airport and someone else is footing the bill; otherwise you'll be disappointed by the lack of caliber of service you would expect at a Hilton property. Being a Northerern who now lives in the South, I know that there is a perception that Northerners are rude, but this experience at the Miami Hilton airport was far worse from anything I've experienced in the North.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Miami Airport Hilton”
Reviews.Author: fedsparents
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Miami for the superbowl weekend. We originally booked our stay at the Homestead Studio Suites, but from the looks of the reception area we decided to look elsewhere. We decided to try the Hilton near the airport eventhough we were previously told they were booked solid (the Chicago Bears were staying there!). We went to the front desk and asked for a room. Not only did we get a room but they upgraded us to a suite at no extra charge. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful through out our stay. The room was worth the increased price they were charging because it was superbowl weekend. We stayed on the 14th floor overlooking the pool and bay. The bed was so comfortable we felt like we were sleeping on clouds. The bathroom had a nice big bathtub. There were couches and flat screen tvs everywhere. The pool and jacuzzi was very nice. This hotel is well worth any price. To our surprise you can even purchase just about everything in the Hilton rooms thru their website. My husband and I are actually thinking about purchasing the mattress (I am not kidding, it was that comfortable!) We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “They overbooked and sent us to another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Krissy80
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 12:30 a.m after a late flight. Although our room was "guaranteed for late arrival" when we got there, the woman told us that they overbooked the hotel since a tour group wanted to stay longer! So we had to get back in the shuttle and she sent us to the Homewood hotel down the street. She said that the hotel was comparabale, but it wasn't at all. Maybe a 2 1/2 star. There was no discount and no apology. Nothing. What kind of hotel overbooks? They had our money regardless whether we showed up or not. We are not pleased and will write to Hilton customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: B787
Reviews.Content: Ok first things first, I wouldn't recomend it if you're staying with kids for a week on a Miami Beach vacation...not really the type of hotel this is; BUT, for short or overnight stays its extremeley confortable and close to the airport with free shuttles every 15 minutes from 5am-1am. The check in staff was great, very friendly and the young man that checked us in (alejandro) he was very nice and made us feel just at home. I would defenetly come back again, good job Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A bit better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Avalancheman
Reviews.Content: Was givien this room over a weekend from a trip we had won. Not a bad stay at all. Room was very clean (although slightly outdated styles) and the bathroom was large (although, again, it was showing it's age slightly). The bed was amazingly comfortable - I think it was the best we had ever slept on. The Cove Restaurant was perfect - great food, great service, and quiet. It was a bit pricey but worth it. The pool was cold but clean and big. The water (blue lagoon) around the property was nice being it was not an ocean front hotel - on the contrary... it is a stones throw from the runways of Miami Inter. Airport. In all honesty, in the room, with the air or vent on, we could barely hear the planes - outside it was quite loud. Overall, very pleased with this property. If we had our choice, we would probably stay elsewhere on a leisure trip, but for business stays, conventions or meetings - I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good layover stay”
Reviews.Author: morganstoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight on our trip from st lucia back to San Antonio. WE had an executive tower room. The room itself was average, the ac wasnt working too great but nothing to really complain about. We ate at the cheaper of the two restruants located in the lobby. The food was pretty good and cheaper than what I would expect for a place in a hilton. The bed was amazing and I fell right asleep when I went to bed. The breaktfast in the executive room was pretty good. It was a great start to the day and I would recommend staying here overnight again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel--not customer service oriented”
Reviews.Author: pamtheeditor
Reviews.Content: had noise problems with room next door--took three hours of complaining before they moved us to a new room--then, Security knocks on our door at 230 in the morning for some unknown reason! Said they couldn't move us because they "didn't have the housekeeping staff' to do so. A nightmare--plus, the hotel charges for EVERYTHING--couldn't use the luggage cart to take our luggage in unless the bellboy helped us, wanted to charge $9.95 for the Internet, $5.00 per 10 minutes in the business center. An absolutely horrible experience--am cancelling my Hilton Honors because of this experience. Miserable.
